''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' }} '''Heramari Iyokus''' is a [[Daimos|Daimotic]] [[sorcerer]] of rank within the [[Scarlet Spires]], and, despite his [[chanv]] addiction, Master of Spies to [[Hanamanu Eleäzaras]].Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Iyokus, Heramari’ He becomes Grandmaster of the Scarlet Spires after Eleäzaras’s death. ==Appearance== Habitual chanv use has turned Iyokus’s skin transparent; and unlike other chanv addicts, he refuses to use cosmetics to compensate. His veins are visible through his skin, his fingernails are dark with bruising, and one can see the dark in the center of his red eyes through his eyelids.''The Darkness That Comes Before,'' Chapter 16 ==References== [[Category:POV characters]] [[Category:Scarlet Spires]] [[Category:Characters from High Ainon]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Grandmasters]] [[Category:Anagogic sorcerers]] [[Category:Daimotic sorcerers]] [[Category:Great Ordeal]]

{{Character infobox | name = Coithus Saubon | titles = Prince
King
Exalt-General | nicknames = The Blond Beast | appearances = ''[[The Darkness That Comes Before]]''
''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]''
''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]''
''[[The Judging Eye (Book) | The Judging Eye]]'' | lived = 4069 - 4132 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Galeoth]] | gender = Male | occupation = Prince of Galeoth
King of [[Caraskand]]
Exalt-General of the Great Ordeal | relatives = [[Coithus Eryeat|Eryeat]] (father)
[[Coithus Narnol|Narnol]] (brother)
[[Coithus Asilda|Asilda]] (sister)
[[Coithus Athjeäri|Athjeäri]] (nephew)
[[Miramis]] (niece)
[[Coithus Agabon|Agabon]] (nephew)
[[Nersei Xinemus|Xinemus]] (great-nephew)
[[Nersei Thaila (younger)|Thaila]] (great-niece) }} '''Coithus Saubon''' is the seventh son of King [[Coithus Eryeat]] of [[Galeoth]] and titular leader of the Galeoth contingent of the [[Holy War]].{{EG|Saubon, Coithus}} ==Appearance== Saubon is strong-jawed and bard-handsome. He has short-cropped, reddish-blond hair. He is not quite as tall as [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]], but stockier. ==Personality== Saubon is highly insecure; he is obsessed with what other people think of him.{{1|17}} ==Story== === ''What came before'' === Saubon commanded the army his father sent against the [[Nansur]]ium several years prior to the [[Holy War]]. He managed several success until [[Ikurei Conphas]] was appointed Exalt-General, at which time Conphas defeated and humiliated him. ===''The Darkness That Comes Before''=== Galeoth troops under Coithus Saubon raid and cut down the inhabitants of a village near [[Pasna]] in retaliation for the [[Ikurei Xerius III|Emperor's]] refusal to provision the Holy War.{{1|15}} When the [[Great Names]] gather before the Emperor to settle the issue of who will lead the host of the Holy War, Saubon sides with [[Nersei Proyas]] in choosing the [[Scylvendi]] [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]] over Ikurei Conphas.{{1|17}} ===''The Warrior-Prophet''=== Saubon seeks [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus | Kellhus']] council about whether to march on [[Gedea]] or wait for the [[High Ainon | Ainoni]] host and the [[Scarlet Spires]]. Kellhus tells him to march and that the [[Anagkë | Whore]] will be kind to him so long as the [[Shrial Knights]] are punished.{{2|4}} Saubon splits from the rest of Holy War along with [[Hoga Gothyelk]]'s [[Tydonni]], the [[Thunyeri]], and the Shrial Knights. Gothyelk's recklessness soon enfuriates Saubon, and the two men nearly come to blows. The Tydonni and Thunyeri follow Gothyelk as he splits from Saubon's host. As Saubon draws near Gedea, he laments that his forces are outnumbered and poorly prepared for the battle ahead. He inwardly rails that no one knows him and curses the various circumstances that led him to this moment. He starts to doubt Kellhus's legitimacy and wonders at the Dunyain's message to "punish" the Shrial Knights. He asks his groom [[Kussalt]] about how sacrifice is perceived in [[The Tractate]] , but is offended by Kussalt's blunt response. Saubon eventually realizes that Gothyelk's men are close by, and the Kianene are trying to prevent them from joining forces. Saubon and Gothyelk reunite and attack the Kianene at Gedea in the [[Fifth Battle of Mengedda]]. Saubon then defeats the [[Fanim]] host just as Kellhus predicted.{{2|6}} When the Holy War reaches [[Caraskand]], Saubon asks Proyas to support his bid to become King of Caraskand in case he delivers the city to the [[Inrithi]]. The Holy War sacks the city and Saubon becomes the titular King of Caraskand.{{2|21}}{{2|24}} ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== The Holy War departs from Caraskand, but Saubon, as King, stays behind.{{3|3}} ===''The Judging Eye''=== Coithos Saubon leads the Great Ordeal as one of its two Exalt-Generals.{{4|1}} ===''The White-Luck Warrior''=== At the Eleventh Council of Potentates, Anasûrimbor Kellhus declares the breaking of the Great Ordeal and King Saubon is charged with leading the [[Ketyai]] of the West.{{5|2}} === ''The Great Ordeal'' === As one of the Exalt Generals, Saubon meets often with Anasûrimbor Kellhus alone like Proyas. Saubon counsels Proyas as he lost certainty in the righteousness of Anasûrimbor Kellhus as a holy prophet to not despair that yes, the great ordeal is just a calculation to the Dunyain and he is testing them, preparing them for a crisis. That everything is theatre but to trust in Kellhus's power and intellect to lead them to victory. Saubon was extremely disturbed to learn of the buggering and that Kellhus admitted he was mad. It seemed to both Saubon and Proyas that this was Saubon's test since as a Galeoth, they abhor sodomy. Saubon blames it on eating the [[Sranc]] meat and states they must continue to act even without belief.{{6|4}} Saubon leads the Company of the Raft to protect Kellhus at [[Dagliash]] from the Horde. When he sees the overwhelming Sranc and enemies, he fathoms the enormity of the gift of death. He then realizes he does believe in the [[The Aspect-Emperor|Holy Aspect-Emperor]] and implores his men to praise him as they are overwhelmed on the tower at Kurwachal.{{6|13}} ==References== [[Category:Kings]] [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:POV characters]] [[Category:Characters from Galeoth]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Great Ordeal]]

{{Character infobox | name = Coithus Athjeäri | titles = Earl of Gaenri | nicknames = Hurall’arkeet
Wind Has Teeth | appearances = ''[[The Darkness That Comes Before]]''
''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]''
''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = 4089 - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Galeoth]] | gender = Male | occupation = Earl of [[Gaenri]] | relatives = [[Coithus Eryeat|Eryeat]] (grandfather)
[[Coithus Narnol|Narnol]] (uncle)
[[Coithus Saubon|Saubon]] (uncle)
[[Coithus Asilda|Asilda]] (mother)
[[Coithus Agabon|Agabon]] (cousin) }} '''Coithus Athjeäri''' is the [[Galeoth]] Earl of [[Gaenri]], and nephew to [[Coithus Saubon]].{{EG|Athjeäri, Coithus}} Considered the eyes of the Holy War,{{3|11}} he would ride out ahead with his men and report back against the [[Fanimry|Fanim]]. == The Thousandfold Thought == As the Holy War was slowly approaching [[Shimeh]], [[Fanayal ab Kascamandri]] took to the field with his [[Coyauri]] and hand-pick Grandees to hunt down that who they called Hurall’arkeet. [[Cinganjehoi ab Sakjal]] was ordered to ride with his [[Eumarna]]ns south in an attempt to try and intercept and ambush Athjeäri and his raiding forces. === The Battle at Madas === Lying in ambush with his forces, Cinganjehoi engaged the Gaenri. Though outnumbered 10 to 1 they met Cinganjehoi’s men in battle. During the fight the son of Seleukaran Grandee stabbed Athjeäri in his face, delivering a fatal blow. At great cost his body is recovered by his men.{{3|11}} ==References== [[Category:Earls]] [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Characters from Galeoth]] [[Category:Men]]

{{Character infobox | name = Yalgrota Sranchammer | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Darkness That Comes Before]]''
''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]''
''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = 4071 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Thunyerus|Thunyeri]] | gender = Male | occupation = Groom of [[Hringa Skaiyelt]] | relatives = }} '''Yalgrota Sranchammer''' is the [[Thunyerus|Thunyeri]] groom of Prince [[Hringa Skaiyelt]], famed for his giant stature and ferocity in war.Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Yalgrota Sranchammer’ == Story == Yalgrota accompanies Skaiyelt to meetings of the Great Names of the Holy War, where his unusual size is noted. When Skaiyelt leads his Thunyeri to split with the Holy War along with [[Coithus Saubon]] and [[Hoga Gothyelk]] to attack [[Gedea]], Yalgrota accompanies him. Yalgrota is unhorsed during the battle, but performs great deeds of heroism, striking down Kianene with his axe and hacking the heads off their horses. ==References== [[Category:Characters from Thunyerus]] [[Category:Norsirai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Tokush | titles = Master of Spies | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Darkness That Comes Before]]'' | lived = 4068 - 4111 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Nansur]] | gender = Male | occupation = Master of Spies | relatives = }}
'''Tokush''' is the Master of Spies to [[Ikurei Xerius III]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Tokush'</ref>
He is killed by the [[skin-spy]] impersonating [[Skeaös]].
==References== <references/> [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Men]]

{{Character infobox | name = Kimish | titles = Prime Interrogator | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Darkness That Comes Before]]'' | lived = 4058 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Nansur]] | gender = Male | occupation = Prime Interrogator | relatives = }}
'''Kimish''' is the Prime Interrogator to [[Ikurei Xerius III]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Kimish'</ref>
==Personality==
Kimish cares only about his trade. He has a penchant for drama when talking about his work.<ref>''The Darkness That Comes Before'', Chapter 18</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Men]]

{{Character infobox | name = Skalateas | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Darkness That Comes Before]]''
''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4069 - 4111 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Nansur Empire|Nansur]] | gender = Male | occupation = [[Mysunsai]] [[Sorcerer]] | relatives = }} '''Skalateas''' is a member of the [[Mysunsai]] [[The Schools|School]], murdered in the [[Anserca]]n countryside by the [[Scarlet Spires]].Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Skalateas’ ==Story== ===''The Darkness That Comes Before''=== Skalateas is present at the interrogation of [[Skeaös]], to verify that he doesn’t bear the [[Mark]], and sees him revealed as a [[skin-spies|skin-spy]]. Like all those present save [[Drusas Achamian]], he mistakenly assumes that skin-spies are a creation of the [[Cishaurim]] rather than the [[Consult]]. ===''The Warrior-Prophet''=== Skalateas is sent to the Scarlet Spires to sell the information about the skin-spies’ existence to [[Hanamanu Eleäzaras]]. However, Eleäzaras intimidates him into revealing the information without payment and insists that he stay as a prisoner of the Scarlet Spires for further questioning. Skalateas refuses and attacks the Grandmaster; after a short battle, Eleäzaras slays him. ==References== [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Anagogic sorcerers]] [[Category:Mysunsai]]

'''''The Syllogistics''''' is a work by the famed philosopher [[Ajencis]], laying out a logic describing the relations between subjects and predicates.{{2|3}}
==References== <references/> [[Category:Written works]]

{{Character infobox | name = Yasellas | titles = | nicknames = Yassi | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = ? - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Female | occupation = Prostitute | relatives = }}
'''Yasellas''' is a prostitute acquiantance of [[Esmenet]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Yasellas'</ref>
==Appearance==
Yasellas is dark-haired and has a brusque, mannish voice. She is stout-limbed and thick-waisted, but not fat.<ref>''The Warrior-Prophet'', Chapter 3</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Prostitutes]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Characters from Nansur]]

{{Character infobox | name = Kussalt | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4054 - 4111 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = Groom to [[Coithus Saubon]] | relatives = }}
'''Kussalt''' is the groom to Prince [[Coithus Saubon]], slain at [[Mengedda]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Kussalt'</ref> ==Story== Kussalt is described as "grizzled," with white hair and implacable eyes. Everything about his appearance is dull and grey. He wears a dented helmet, caring nothing for his appearance, which Coithus Saubon says makes him look more impressive rather than less.
Saubon's earliest memory is getting scooped up by Kussalt after being stung by a bee. The groom has served him all his life. Kussalt joins Saubon at Mengedda, serving as an advanced scout before returning to the prince's side. Kussalt reveals that he has memorized [[The Tractate]] and tries to answer Saubon's question about sacrifice, but Saubon is unsatisifed.
==References== <references/> [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Characters from Galeoth]]

{{Character infobox | name = Nersei Sodhoras | titles = Baron | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4072 - 4111 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Conriya]]n | gender = Male | occupation = Baron | relatives = [[Nersei Proyas]] (cousin) }}
'''Nersei Sodhoras''' is a [[Conriya]]n Baron and cousin of Prince [[Nersei Proyas]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Sodhoras, Nersei'</ref>
He is killed in a minor skirmish with the [[Kian]]ene prior to the [[Fifth Battle of Mengedda]].
==References== <references/> [[Category:Barons]] [[Category:Characters from Conriya]] [[Category:Ketyai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Nin’janjin | titles = King | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - | race = [[Nonmen]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Viri]] | gender = Male | occupation = Nonman King of Viri | relatives = }}
'''Nin’janjin''' is the former [[Nonman]] King of [[Viri]].
Nin’janjin was the ruler of the Mansion of Viri at the time the [[Incû-Holoinas]] fell from the void. The fall of the Ark caused a natural disaster and sent up ash-clouds that darkened the skies, resulting in a famine. Nin’janjin appealed to his kinsman [[Cû’jara-Cinmoi]], the King of [[Siöl]], for help. But instead, Cû’jara-Cinmoi invaded and claimed Viri.
The [[Inchoroi]], emerging from the Ark, sent a secret emissary to Nin’janjin. At this point, they had “birthed mouths” and could speak Ihrimsû. They reminded Nin’janjin of Cu’jara-Cinmoi’s treachery. Seeking revenge, Nin’janjin and his warriors rose up in rebellion and joined the Inchoroi for the [[Battle of Pir Pahal]], the first battle of the [[Cûno-Inchoroi Wars]]. However, upon seeing the shockingly horrific nature of their would-be allies, Nin’janjin’s warriors rebelled against him and instead joined Cû’jara-Cinmoi’s forces. The Inchoroi were overpowered and lost the resulting battle. However, when they fled back into the Incû-Holoinas, they took Nin’janjin with them.
Several years later, when Cû’jara-Cinmoi had grown old and frail, Nin’janjin emerged from the Ark asking to see him. Cû’jara-Cinmoi was astonished to see that his old enemy had not aged. Nin’janjin revealed that the Inchoroi knew the secrets of immortality. He agreed to grant the Inchoroi mercy in exchange for the gift of eternal life. However, the Inchoroi medications which granted immortality were a cursed gift - they gave rise to the [[Womb Plague]] which spread rapidly and killed all the women of Cûnuroi. Only the males survived, now a race without a future.
The Nonmen went to war against the Inchoroi, seeking vengeance for their dead wives and daughters, and for the eventual extinction of their race. The [[Battle of Pir Minginnial]] raged on the plain of the [[Inniür-Shigogli]], and Nin’janjin turned against his old enemy Cû’jara-Cinmoi in the midst of the battlefield. And this time, when they fought, Nin’janjin killed him with a spear thrust.<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Cûno-Inchoroi Wars’</ref>
Nin'janjin's fate is unclear: it is known that he spoke to [[Nil'giccas]] after his victory at the [[Battle of Isal’imial]] and told him about the [[Inverse Fire]] and the [[Golden Room]] at the heart of the Incû-Holoinas, resulting in Nil'giccas sending three explorers to investigate further. When two of them returned gibbering and raving, Nil'giccas put them to death on the advice of the third, [[Cet’ingira]] and abandoned the Ark, raising the [[Barricades]] about it. It is possible that Nil'giccas had Nin'janjin executed for his treachery.<ref>''[[The False Sun]]''</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Cûnuroi]] [[Category:Kings]]

The ''' Inniür-Shigogli''' (“Black Furnace Plain” in Ihrimsû), is the blasted plain within the [[Ring Mountains]] created by the heat and force of the [[Incû-Holoinas]]’s descent.<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Cûno-Inchoroi Wars’</ref>
==Features== * [[Golgotterath]]
==References== <references /> [[Category:Plains]]

{{Character infobox | name = Hringa Narradha | titles = Prince of Thunyerus | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4093 - 4111 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Thunyerus|Thunyeri]] | gender = Male | occupation = Prince of Thunyerus | relatives = [[Hringa Rauschang]] (father)
[[Hringa Skaiyelt]] (brother)
[[Hringa Hulwarga]] (brother) }} '''Hringa Narradha''' is the youngest brother of Prince [[Hringa Skaiyelt]], slain at the [[Fifth Battle of Mengedda]].Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Narradha, Hringa’ ==References== [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Characters from Thunyerus]] [[Category:Men]]

{{Character infobox | name = Thagawain Anfirig | titles = Earl of Gesindal | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]''
''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = 4057 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Galeoth]] | gender = Male | occupation = Earl of [[Gesindal]] | relatives = }} '''Thagawain Anfirig''' is the [[Galeoth]] Earl of [[Gesindal]].Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Anfirig, Thagawain’ ==References== [[Category:Characters from Galeoth]] [[Category:Earls]] [[Category:Norsirai]]

'''Agmundr''' is a fiefdom of northeastern [[Galeoth]], located beneath the [[Osthwai Mountains]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Agmundr’</ref>
The Earl of Agmundr is [[Braelwan Cynnea]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Cynnea, Braelwan’</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Fiefdoms]]

The '''Vulgar Holy War''' is the name given to the first contingent of the [[Holy War]] to march against the [[Fanim]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Vulgar Holy War’</ref>
Emperor [[Ikurei Xerius III]] conspired to send the first half of the Holy War to its destruction, for multiple political reasons: to confirm a secret alliance with the Fanim, and to convince [[Maithanet]] and the other nobles of the Holy War of the strength of the Fanim so that they would accept his Indenture in exchange for the leadership of [[Ikurei Conphas]]. His machinations are successful, and the entire group that marches is wiped out at the [[Fourth Battle of Mengedda]].
The group was known as the Vulgar Holy War because it consisted primarily of rabble rather than professional soldiers or nobles.<ref>''The Darkness That Comes Before'', Chapter 11</ref>
==Participants== * [[Akori Kumrezzer]] * [[Gedapharus]] * [[Heänar Tharschilka]] * [[Istratmenni]] * [[Nersei Calmemunis]]
==References== <references /> [[Category:War]] [[Category:Present Era]]

{{Character infobox | name = Akori Kumrezzer | titles = Palatine of Kutapileth | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Darkness That Comes Before]]'' | lived = 4071 - 4110 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[High Ainon|Ainon]]i | gender = Male | occupation = Palatine of [[Kutapileth]] | relatives = }}
'''Akori Kumrezzer''' is the Palatine of the [[High Ainon|Ainon]]i palatinate of [[Kutapileth]], and one of the leaders of the [[Vulgar Holy War]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Kumrezzar, Akori’</ref>
He is killed at the [[Fourth Battle of Mengedda]], and his severed head sent back to the [[Nansur Empire]].
==Trivia== * Akori’s last name is alternately spelled “Kumrezzer” in ''The Darkness That Comes Before'' and “Kumrezzar” in the Encyclopedic Glossary.
==References== <references /> [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Palatines]] [[Category:Vulgar Holy War]] [[Category:Characters from High Ainon]]

The '''White Jihad''' was a holy war waged against the [[Nansur Empire]] by [[Fan’oukarji I]] and the [[Kian]]ene from 3743 to 3771.<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘White Jihad’</ref>
The war was highly successful for the Kianene, resulting in the conquest of all of [[Mongilea]] and some of [[Eumarna]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Kian’</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:War]] [[Category:Present Era]]

The '''Scholastic Wars''' were a series of holy wars waged against the [[School]]s from 3796 to 3818.
Called by [[Ekyannus XIV]], the Scholastic Wars saw the near-destruction of several schools and the beginning of the [[Scarlet Spires]]' hegemony over [[High Ainon]]<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, p. 482, 'Scholastic Wars'</ref>.
Another consequence was the amalgamation of the [[Mikka Council]], the [[Oaranat]], and the [[Nilitar Compact]] into the [[Mysunsai]] in 3804<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, p. 468, 'Mysunsai'</ref>.
==References== <references/> [[Category:War]] [[Category:Present Era]]

The '''Mikka Council''' was a minor [[Anagogic]] [[School]] in ancient [[Cironj]].
In 3804, during the [[Scholastic Wars]], it combined with the [[Oaranat]] and the [[Nilitar Compact]] to become the [[Mysunsai]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Mysunsai'</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Schools]]

The '''Oaranat''' was a minor [[Anagogic]] [[School]] in ancient [[Nilnamesh]].
In 3804, during the [[Scholastic Wars]], it combined with the [[Mikka Council]] and the [[Nilitar Compact]] to become the [[Mysunsai]]<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, p. 468, 'Mysunsai'</ref>.
==References== <references/> [[Category:Schools]]

The '''Nilitar Compact''' was a minor [[Anagogic]] [[School]] in ancient ([[Cengemis|Cengemic]]) [[Ce Tydonn]].
In 3804, during the [[Scholastic Wars]], it combined with the [[Mikka Council]] and the [[Oaranat]] to become the [[Mysunsai]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Mysunsai'</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Schools]]

{{Character infobox | name = Sos-Praniura | titles = | nicknames =Lord-of-Poisons | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought]]'' (mentioned)
''[[The Unholy Consult]]'' | lived = ? - 4132 | race = [[Cûnuroi]] | ethnicity = | nationality =[[Cil-Aujas]] (presumably) | gender = Male | occupation = [[Qûya]]
Founder of the [[Mangaecca]]
Member of the [[Consult]] | relatives = }} '''Sos-Praniura''' was a [[Nonman]] [[Qûya]]Since Sos-Praniura founded the Mangaecca in 684 and was still alive in 4132, yet is never mentioned as having achieved some form of immortality like Shaeönanra, it can be assumed he was in fact a Nonman and not a [[Men|Man]]. His sobriquet, "Lord-of-Poisons" is also reminiscent of those of other Nonmen, such as [[Cilcûliccas]]'s "Lord of Swans". and the founder of the [[Mangaecca]]. He was said to be the greatest student of [[Gin'yursis]]. == Story == === What Came Before === In 684, Sos-Praniura founded the Mangaecca, the [[School]] which would later become the [[Consult]]Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Mangaecca'. While [[Shaeönanra]] was the Grandmaster of the Mangaecca at the time it became the Consult, Sos-Praniura eventually joined its ranks as well''The Unholy Consult'', Chapter 15. === ''The Unholy Consult'' === Sos-Praniura and other Qûya working for the Consult fought the [[Swayal Compact|Swayali]], [[Mandate|Mandati]] and [[Mysunsai]] led by [[Anasûrimbor Serwa]] during the battle for [[Golgotterath]]. He was among those killed during this confrontation. ==Notes== ==References== [[Category:Mangaecca]] [[Category:Cûnuroi]] [[Category:Qûya]] [[Category:Consult members]]

{{Character infobox | name = Hanalinqû | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - ? | race = [[Nonmen]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Siöl]] | gender = Female | occupation = Wife of [[Cû’jara-Cinmoi]] | relatives = }}
'''Hanalinqû''' was the legendary wife of [[Cû’jara-Cinmoi]], High King of the [[Nonmen]].
According to the ''[[Isûphiryas]]'', Hanalinqû was the first victim of the Womb-Plague engineered by the [[Inchoroi]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Cûno-Inchoroi Wars'</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Cûnuroi]] [[Category:Characters from the Ancient North]]

{{stub}} {{Character infobox | name = Skauras ab Nalajan | titles = Sapatishah-Governor of Shigek | nicknames = Sutis Sutadra
Southern Jackal | appearances = ''[[The Darkness That Comes Before]]''
''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4052 - 4111 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Kian]]ene | gender = Male | occupation = Sapatishah-Governor of [[Shigek]] | relatives = [[Hasjinnet ab Skauras]] (son) }} [[File:Skr by quintvc-d83bfgd.png|thumb|300px|Skauras ab Nalajan by Quinthane.]] '''Skauras ab Nalajan''' is the Sapatishah-Governor of [[Shigek]] and the first principal antagonist of the [[Holy War|First Holy War]], slain at [[Anwurat]]. A veteran of many wars, he was deeply respected by both his allies and his enemies. The [[Nansur Empire|Nansur]] called him Sutis Sutadra, the “Southern Jackal,” because of his Black Jackal standard.Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Skauras ab Nalajan’ ==Appearance== Skauras’s hair is white, but still thick. He has a distinguished face with a long mustache and thin braided beard.''The Warrior-Prophet,'' Chapter 15 ==Personality== Skauras is fearless. He is a severe disciplinarian, possesses a gift for organization, and commands the respect of even those who otherwise outrank him. He also has a mischievous streak, often drugging his guest’s wine with narcotics and [[chanv]]. He likes to trick, to deceive, to show, and to prove.''The Warrior-Prophet,'' Chapter 13 ==References== [[Category:POV characters]] [[Category:Characters from Kian]] [[Category:Sapatishahs]] [[Category:Ketyai]]

{{Stub}}
The '''Sohonc''' was a [[Gnostic]] [[School]] of the [[Ancient North]].
Its last Grandmaster, [[Seswatha]], would go on to found the School of [[Mandate]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Seswatha'</ref>
== Known Members == * [[Noshainrau]] (founder) * [[Outhrata]] (Grandmaster) * [[Seswatha]] (Grandmaster) * [[Titirga]] (Grandmaster)
==References== <references/> [[Category:Schools]]

{{Character infobox | name = Biaxi Sompas | titles = General | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = 4068 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Nansur]] | gender = Male | occupation = General of the [[Kidruhil]] | relatives = [[Biaxi Coronsas]] (father) }}
'''Biaxi Sompas''' is the General of the [[Kidruhil]] following the death of General [[Thallei Numemarius]] in [[Nagogris]].
Sompas is the eldest son of [[Biaxi Coronsas]], Patridomos of [[House Biaxi]] .<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Sompas, Biaxi'</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:POV characters]] [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Members of the Kidruhil]] [[Category:Ketyai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Thallei Numemarius | titles = Patridomos
General | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4069 - 4111 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Nansur]] | gender = Male | occupation = Patridomos of House Thallei
General of the [[Kidruhil]] | relatives = }} '''Thallei Numemarius''' is the Patridomos of House Thallei, and General of the [[Kidruhil]] until his death in [[Nagogris]].Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Numemarius, Thallei' Numemarius's death results from infighting among the [[Holy War]]. [[Ikurei Conphas]] promises Imperial protection to Nagogris in exchange for the city's surrender, but the [[Thunyeri]] begin plundering the city regardless. When the Kidruhil try to stop them, fighting breaks out between the two factions. Numemarius attempts to speak to [[Yalgrota Sranchammer]] under a flag of truce, only to be killed.''The Warrior-Prophet'', Chapter 11 ==References== [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Members of the Kidruhil]] [[Category:Men]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The '''Kidruhil''' is the most celebrated cohort of heavy cavalry in the [[Three Seas]], primarily consituted by [[Nansur]] caste-nobles from the Houses of the Congregate<ref>Enc..."
revision.text:
The '''Kidruhil''' is the most celebrated cohort of heavy cavalry in the [[Three Seas]], primarily consituted by [[Nansur]] caste-nobles from the Houses of the Congregate<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, p. 459, 'Kidruhil'</ref>.
==Generals== * [[Biaxi Sompas]] * [[Thallei Numemarius]]
==References== <references/> [[Category:Organizations]]

'''Kiünnat''' is the traditional religious system of the [[Three Seas]], based on ''[[The Chronicle of the Tusk]].''
While Kiünnat was reformed by [[Inri Sejenus]] into [[Inrithism]], it persists in the form of the various [[Cults]] subordinate to the [[Thousand Temples]]. Whereas Inrithism regards the [[Gods]] as aspects of the [[God of Gods]], traditional Kiünnat regards the Gods as independent spiritual agencies, prone to indirectly intervene in the lives of their worshippers.<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Hundred Gods’</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Belief systems]]

The '''Dagger Jihad''' was a holy war waged against the [[Nansur Empire]] by [[Fan’oukarji III]] and the [[Kian]]ene in 3933.
The war was highly successful for the Kianene, resulting in the conquest of [[Shigek]] and [[Gedea]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Nansur Empire’</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:War]] [[Category:Present Era]]

{{Character infobox | name = Hifanat ab Tunukri | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4084 - 4111 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Indara-Kishauri]] | gender = Male | occupation = [[Cishaurim]] | relatives = }}
'''Hifanat ab Tunukri''' is a [[Cishaurim]] [[sorcerer]]-priest and servant of [[Anasûrimbor Moënghus]], slain at [[Caraskand]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Hifanat ab Tunukri’</ref>
==Appearance== Like all Cishaurim, Hifanat lacks eyes, instead sharing the vision of two snakes coiled about his neck.
==Story== ===''The Warrior-Prophet''=== During the capture of Caraskand, Hifanat delivers [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]] a message from his father, Moënghus. After receiving the message, Kellhus beheads him.<ref>''The Warrior-Prophet,'' Chapter 21</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Cishaurim]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Characters from Kian]]

{{Character infobox | name = Aethelarius VI | titles = King of Atrithau | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = 4062 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Atrithau]] | gender = Male | occupation = King of Atrithau | relatives = }}
'''Aethelarius VI''' is the King of [[Atrithau]], last in the line of Morghund.
“Aethelarius” is Sheyic form of “Athullara.”<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Aethelarius VI’</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Characters from Atrithau]] [[Category:Kings]] [[Category:Norsirai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Ansacer ab Salajka | titles = Sapatishah-Governor | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4072 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Gedea]]n | gender = Male | occupation = Sapatishah-Governor of [[Gedea]] | relatives = }}
'''Ansacer ab Salajka''' is the Sapatishah-Governor of [[Gedea]].
The Black Gazelle is his totem.<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Ansacer ab Salajka'</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Characters from Kian]] [[Category:Sapatishahs]]

{{Character infobox | name = Arweal | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4077 - 4111 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Ce Tydonn|Tydonni]] | gender = Male | occupation = Client thane to [[Rilding Werijen Greatheart]]
[[Nascenti]] | relatives = }} '''Arweal''' is one of the [[Nascenti]], formerly a client thane of Earl [[Rilding Werijen Greatheart]], claimed by disease at [[Caraskand]].Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Arweal’ ==References== [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Nascenti]] [[Category:Characters from Ce Tydonn]] [[Category:Thanes]]

The '''Cond''' were a group of [[Norsirai]] pastoralists of the Near [[Istyuli Plains]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Condic’</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Tribes]]

{{Character infobox | name = Hirul Detnammi | titles = Palatine of Eshkalas | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4081 - 4111 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[High Ainon|Ainon]]i | gender = Male | occupation = Palatine of [[Eshkalas]] | relatives = }}
'''Hirul Detnammi''' is the Palatine of the [[High Ainon|Ainon]]i palatinate of [[Eshkalas]], slain at [[Subis]] under dishonorable circumstances.<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Detnammi, Hirul’</ref>
==Story== ===''The Warrior-Prophet''=== During the [[Holy War]]’s crossing of the [[Carathay Desert]], Detnammi is one of a number of raiders sent on a mission to trail the [[Khirgwi]] harassing the Ainoni and find their water supply. However, Detnammi and 459 of his followers decide to desert the main force of the Holy War and flee towards Subis to save themselves. There they are ambushed and killed, and their bodies used to pollute the waters. The circumstances surrounding his fate are only realized by the rest of the Holy War when they reach Subis themselves days later, and for his crime he is posthumously denounced and stripped of his rank and station.<ref>''The Warrior-Prophet,'' Chapter 18</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Characters from High Ainon]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Palatines]]

'''Subis''' is a once-fortified oasis in [[Khemema]], frequented by caravans passing between [[Shigek]] and [[Eumarna]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Subis’</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Seas]]

{{Character infobox | name = Dunjoksha | titles = Sapatishah-Governor | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4055 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = Sapatishah-Governor of [[Amoteu]] | relatives = }}
'''Dunjoksha''' is the Sapatishah-Governor of Holy [[Amoteu]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Dunjoksha'</ref>
He has a reputation among the [[Inrithi]] as a tyrant.<ref>''The Warrior-Prophet'', Chapter 13</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Sapatishahs]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Characters from Kian]]

{{Stub}} {{Character infobox | name = Fanayal ab Kascamandri | titles = Crown Prince of Kian
Padirajah of Kian | nicknames = Bandit Padirajah | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]''
''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]''
''[[The Judging Eye (Book)|The Judging Eye]]''
''[[The White-Luck Warrior (Book)|The White-Luck Warrior]]'' | lived = 4075 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Kian]]ene | gender = Male | occupation = Crown Prince of Kian
[[Padirajah]] of Kian | relatives = [[Kascamandri ab Tepherokar]] (father)
[[Sirol ab Kascamandri]] (sister) }} '''Fanayal ab Kascamandri''' is the first-born son of [[Padirajah]] of [[Kian]] [[Kascamandri ab Tepherokar]], and leader of the [[Coyauri]], his famed elite heavy cavalry.Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Fanayal ab Kascamandri’ ==Story== ===''The Warrior-Prophet''=== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== ===''The Judging Eye''=== ===''The White-Luck Warrior''=== ===''The Unholy Consult''=== ==References== [[Category:Characters from Kian]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Padirajahs]]

{{Character infobox | name = Ingalira | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - ? | race = [[Nonmen]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Siöl]] | gender = Male | occupation = [[Ishroi]] | relatives = }}
'''Ingalira''' is a [[Nonmen]] hero of [[Siöl]] mentioned in the ''[[Isûphiryas]]''.
After the fall of the [[Incû-Holoinas]], the Nonman King [[Cû’jara-Cinmoi]] sent Ingalira on an expedition to the Ark. He returned months later with two [[Inchoroi]] prisoners, who Cû’jara-Cinmoi had put to death.
Ingalira later fought in the [[Cûno-Inchoroi Wars]]. After the death of the Nonmen women to the Womb-Plague, Ingalira faced the Inchoroi in battle on the [[Inniür-Shigogli]]. He strangled the mighty Inchoroi [[Vshikcrû]] to death, but was himself slain later in the battle.<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Cûno-Inchoroi Wars'</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Cûnuroi]] [[Category:Ishroi]] [[Category:Characters from the Ancient North]]

{{Character infobox | name = Fustaras | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4061 - 4111 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = Soldier | relatives = }}
'''Fustaras''' is an Orthodox agitator and proadjunct from the [[Selial Column]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Fustaras'</ref>
He is a "Threesie", someone who signed a third fourteen-year term in the Imperial Army rather than taking his Imperial Pension.<ref>''The Warrior-Prophet'', Chapter 22</ref>
==Story==
===''The Warrior-Prophet''===
Fustaras is one of several officers instructed by [[Biaxi Sompas]] to crack down on [[Zaudunyani]] agitators during the siege of [[Caraskand]]. When Fustaras clubs one of the Zaudunyani Judges, a riot starts and he is killed by a [[Thunyeri]] soldier.
==References== <references/> [[Category:POV characters]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Members of the Imperial Army]]

{{Character infobox | name = Algari | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4041 - 4111 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Cironj]]i | gender = Male | occupation = Body-slave | relatives = }}
'''Algari''' is old [[Cironj]]i body-slave to Prince [[Nersei Proyas]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Algari’</ref>
Algari dies during the [[Holy War]]’s crossing of the [[Carathay Desert]], as water is rationed exclusively to those of higher [[caste]].<ref>''The Warrior-Prophet,'' Chapter 19</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Slaves]] [[Category:Characters from Cironj]]

{{Character infobox | name = Nisht Galgota | titles = Palatine of Eshganax | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4062 - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[High Ainon|Ainon]]i | gender = Male | occupation = Palatine of [[Eshganax]] | relatives = }}
'''Nisht Galgota''' is the Palatine of the [[High Ainon|Ainon]]i palatinate of [[Eshganax]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Galgota, Nisht’</ref>
==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Galgota is slain during the battle for [[Shimeh]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 16</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Palatines]] [[Category:Characters from High Ainon]] [[Category:Ketyai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Murworg Ganbrota | titles = Earl of Ingraul | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = 4064 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Thunyerus|Thunyeri]] | gender = Male | occupation = Earl of [[Ingraul]] | relatives = }}
'''Murworg Ganbrota''' is the Earl of the [[Thunyerus|Thunyeri]] fiefdom of [[Ingraul]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Ganbrota, Murworg’</ref>
==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== As the [[Holy War]] marches for [[Shimeh]], Ganbrota and the Ingraulish under his command attack the walled town of [[Naïth]] in the foothills of the [[Betmulla Mountains]] and burn it to the ground.
==References== <references /> [[Category:Characters from Thunyerus]] [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Earls]]

{{Character infobox | name = Amurrei Ganyatti | titles = Palatine of Ankirioth | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]''
''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = 4064 - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Conriya]]n | gender = Male | occupation = Palatine of [[Ankirioth]] | relatives = }} '''Amurrei Ganyatti''' is the [[Conriya]]n Palatine of the district of [[Ankirioth]].Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Ganyatti, Amurrei’ ==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Ganyatti is slain by Prince [[Hûkal]] during the battle for [[Shimeh]].''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 15 ==References== [[Category:Characters from Conriya]] [[Category:Palatines]] [[Category:Ketyai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Gaörta | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Darkness That Comes Before]]''
''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Skin-spies|Skin-spy]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = [[Consult]] spy | relatives = }} '''Gaörta''' is the true name of the second [[Skin-spies|skin-spy]] to pose as [[Cutias Sarcellus]].Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Gaörtha’ ==Story== ===''The Darkness That Comes Before''=== Gaörta is assigned to spy on [[Drusas Achamian]]. Achamian spots Gaörta following him, but Gaörta is able to escape by changing his face. ===''The Warrior-Prophet''=== After the destruction of [[Maëngi]] in the [[Fifth Battle of Mengedda]], Gaörta takes over the role of Cutias Sarcellus. As Sarcellus, Gaörta has [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]] convicted as a false prophet and sentenced to death. However, [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]] kills Gaörta and exposes him as a skin-spy before Kellhus dies. ==Trivia== * Gaörta’s name is alternately spelled “Gaörta” in ''The Warrior-Prophet,'' Chapters 21 and 22 and “Gaörtha” in ''The Darkness That Comes Before,'' ''The Warrior-Prophet,'' Chapter 15 and the Encyclopedic Glossary. ==References== [[Category:POV characters]] [[Category:Skin-spies]] [[Category:Consult members]] [[Category:Characters from Golgotterath]]

{{Character infobox | name = Sattushal Gayamakri | titles = Baron
Seneschal-Secretary | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]''
''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = 4070 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[High Ainon|Ainon]]i | gender = Male | occupation = Baron
[[Nascenti]]
Seneschal-Secretary to [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]] | relatives = }} '''Sattushal Gayamakri''' is one of the [[Nascenti]], formerly an [[High Ainon|Ainon]]i baron.Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Gayamakri, Sattushal’ ==References== [[Category:Characters from High Ainon]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Nascenti]] [[Category:Barons]]

The '''Nascenti''' are the nine primary disciples of [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]], the so-called “Thanes of the Warrior-Prophet.”<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Nascenti’</ref>
==Members== * [[Arweal]] * [[Cwithar Ottma]] * [[Hagum Persommas]] * [[Memshressa Kasaumki]] * [[Porsentius Kasalla]] * [[Sainhail Werjau]] * [[Sattushal Gayamakri]] * [[Shaugar Ulnarta]] * [[Solm Hilderath]] * [[Tshuma]]
==References== <references /> [[Category:Occupations]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The '''Coyauri''' are the famed elite heavy cavalry of the [[Kian]]ene Padirajah, first organized by [[Habal ab Sarouk]] in 3892 as a response to the [[Nansur]] [[Kidruhil]]. Th..."
revision.text:
The '''Coyauri''' are the famed elite heavy cavalry of the [[Kian]]ene Padirajah, first organized by [[Habal ab Sarouk]] in 3892 as a response to the [[Nansur]] [[Kidruhil]].
The White Horse on Yellow is their standard<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, p. 430, 'Coyauri'</ref>.
==Members== * [[Fanayal ab Kascamandri]]
==References== <references/> [[Category:Organizations]]

{{Character infobox | name = Dun Heörsa | titles = Shield-Captain | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = 4078 - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Galeoth]] | gender = Male | occupation = Thane
Shield-Captain | relatives = }} '''Dun Heörsa''' is a Shield-Captain of the [[Hundred Pillars]], formerly a [[Galeoth]] thane.Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Heörsa, Dun' ==Appearance== Heörsa has blue eyes.''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 1 ==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== After the [[Battle of Caraskand]], Heörsa brings [[Drusas Achamian]] to [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]]. When the [[Holy War]] camps outside [[Shimeh]], [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]] places a glamour on Heörsa, disguising him as Drusas Achamian, and has him sleep in Achamian's room. A [[skin-spy]] sent to assassinate Achamian kills Heörsa instead, and is subsequently dispatched.''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 12 ==References== [[Category:Thanes]] [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Characters from Galeoth]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The '''Hundred Pillars''' are the Warrior-Prophet [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]]'s personal bodyguard, named after the one hundred men rumored to have surrendered their water -- and th..."
revision.text:
The '''Hundred Pillars''' are the Warrior-Prophet [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]]'s personal bodyguard, named after the one hundred men rumored to have surrendered their water -- and their lives -- to him on the [[Trail of Skulls]]<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, p. 451, 'Hundred Pillars'</ref>.
==Members== * [[Dun Heörsa]]
==References== <references/> [[Category:Organizations]]

{{Character infobox | name = Solm Hilderath | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4072 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Ce Tydonn|Tydonni]] | gender = Male | occupation = Thane
[[Nascenti]] | relatives = }} '''Solm Hilderath''' is one of the [[Nascenti]], formerly a [[Ce Tydonn|Tydonni]] thane.Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Hilderath, Solm’ ==References== [[Category:Thanes]] [[Category:Nascenti]] [[Category:Characters from Ce Tydonn]] [[Category:Norsirai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Sonhail Hortha | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4064 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Galeoth]] | gender = Male | occupation = Knight | relatives = }}
'''Sonhail Hortha''' is a [[Galeoth]] knight, client to Prince [[Coithus Saubon]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Hortha, Sonhail’</ref>
==Story== ===''The Warrior-Prophet''=== Hortha is one of the soldiers who accompanies Saubon and [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]] in the raiding party that infiltrates [[Caraskand]] with the aid of the traitor [[Kepfet ab Tanaj]] and opens the Gate of Horns for the [[Holy War]].<ref>''The Warrior-Prophet,'' Chapter 21</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Characters from Galeoth]] [[Category:Norsirai]]

'''Skagwa''' is a fiefdom on the [[Thunyerus|Thunyeri]] [[Sranc]] Marches.<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Skagwa’</ref>
The Earl of Skagwa is [[Saweor Inskarra]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Inskarra, Saweor’</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Fiefdoms]]

{{Character infobox | name = Porsentius Kasalla | titles = Captain in the Imperial Army | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4062 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Nansur Empire|Nansur]] | gender = Male | occupation = Captain in the Imperial Army
[[Nascenti]] | relatives = }} '''Porsentius Kasalla''' is one of the [[Nascenti]], formerly a Captain in the Imperial Army.Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Kasalla, Porsentius’ ==References== [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Nascenti]] [[Category:Members of the Imperial Army]]

{{Character infobox | name = Memshressa Kasaumki | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4072 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Conriya]]n | gender = Male | occupation = Knight
[[Nascenti]] | relatives = }} '''Memshressa Kasaumki''' is one of the [[Nascenti]], formerly a [[Conriya]]n knight.Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Kasaumki, Memshressa’ ==Appearance== Kasaumki has white hair.''The Warrior-Prophet,'' Chapter 22 ==References== [[Category:Characters from Conriya]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Nascenti]]

{{Character infobox | name = Ersa Kushigas | titles = Palatine | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]''
''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' (mentioned)
''[[The Unholy Consult]]'' (mentioned) | lived = 4070 - 4111 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Conriya]]n | gender = Male | occupation = Palatine of [[Annand]] | relatives = }} '''Ersa''' '''Kushigas''' was the Palatine of the [[Conriya]]n province of [[Annand]], slain at the [[Battle of Anwurat]].Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Kushigas'Encyclopedic Glossary II, 'Kushigas, Ersa' ==References== [[Category:Palatines]] [[Category:Characters from Conriya]] [[Category:Ketyai]]

'''Kutnarmu''' is the generic name for the unexplored continent to the south of [[Eärwa]]. Nothing is known of its inhabitants or geography. The [[Ketyai]] nation of [[Cingulat]] is stated to be on the north coast.<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Kutnarmu’</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Continents]]
[[Category:In-universe]]

Until the [[Gates of Eärwa|Breaking of the Gates]] and the migration of the Four Nations from [[Eänna]], the [[Men]] of [[Eärwa]], called the [[Emwama]] in ''[[The Chronicle of the Tusk]]'', were enslaved by the [[Nonmen]] and spoke debased versions of their masters’ tongues. No trace of these languages remain. Nor does any trace of their original, pre-bondage language remain. The great Nonman history, the ''[[Isûphiryas]]'', or the “Great Pit of Years,” suggests the Emwama originally spoke the same tongue as their kin across the [[Great Kayarsus]].
This has led many to believe that [[Thoti-Eännorean]] is indeed the primeval language of all men. From it are derived all other Mannish languages.
#'''Vasnosri''': Language group of the [[Norsirai]] peoples. #*'''Aumri-Saugla''': Language group of the ancient Norsirai peoples of the [[River Aumris|Aumris]] Valley. #**'''Ûmeritic''': Lost language of ancient [[Ûmerau]]. #***'''Kûnüric''': Lost language of ancient [[Kûniüri]]. #****'''Dûnyainic''': Language of the [[Dûnyain]]. #*'''Nirsodic''': Language group of ancient Norsirai pastoralists ranging from the Sea of [[Cerish]] to the Sea of [[Jorua]]. #**'''Akksersian''': Lost language of ancient [[Akksersia]] and “purest” of the Nirsodic Tongues. #**'''Condic''': Language group of ancient pastoralists of the Near [[Istyuli Plains]]. #***'''Eämnoric''': Lost language of ancient [[Eämnor]]. #****'''Atrithi''': Language of [[Atrithau]]. #**'''Skettic''': Language group of ancient pastoralists of the Far Istyuli Plains. #***'''High Sakarpean''': Language of ancient [[Sakarpus]]. #****'''Sakarpic''': Language of Sakarpus. #**'''Old Meoric''': Lost language of the early [[Meöri Empire|Meörn Empire]]. #***'''Meoric''': Lost language of the late Meorn Empire. #****'''Gallish''': Language of [[Galeoth]]. #****'''Thunyeric''': Language of [[Thunyerus]]. #****'''Tydonni''': Language of [[Ce Tydonn]]. #****'''Cepaloran''': Language group of pastoralists of the [[Cepalor]]an Plains. #*****'''Nymbricani''': Language of the [[Nymbricani]] clans. #'''Kengetic''': Language group of the [[Ketyai]] peoples. #*'''Kemkaric''': Language group of the ancient Ketyai pastoralists of the Northwestern [[Three Seas]]. #**'''Kyranean''': Lost language of ancient [[Kyraneas]]. #***'''High Sheyic''': Language of [[Ceneian Empire]]. #****'''Low Sheyic''': Language of the [[Nansur]] Empire and lingua franca of the Three Seas. #**'''Soroptic''': Lost language of ancient [[Shigek]]. #*'''Hamoric''': Language group of the ancient Ketyai pastoralists of the Eastern Three Seas. #**'''Ham-Kheremic''': Lost language of ancient [[Shir]]. #***'''Sheyo-Kheremic''': Lost language of the lower castes of the Eastern Ceneian Empire. #****'''Conriyan''': Language of [[Conriya]]. #****'''Nroni''': Language of [[Nron]]. #****'''Cironjic''': Language of [[Cironj]]. #****'''Cengemic''': Language of [[Cengemis]]. #****'''Sansori''': Language of [[Sansor]]. #***'''Old Ainoni''': Language of Ceneian-occupied [[High Ainon|Ainon]]. #****'''Ainoni''': Language of High Ainon. #*'''Shem-Varsi''': Language group of the ancient pastoralists of the Southwestern Three Seas. #**'''Vaparsi''': Lost language of ancient [[Nilnamesh]]. #***'''High Vurumandic''': Language of Nilnameshi ruling castes. #***'''Sapmatari''': Lost language of Nilnameshi laboring castes. #****'''Sheyo-Buskrit''': Language of Nilnameshi labouring castes. #****'''Girgashi''': Language of Fanic-[[Girgash]]. #****'''Cinguli''': Language of [[Cingulat]]. #***'''Xerashi''': Lost language of scriptural [[Xerash]]. #****'''Sheyo-Xerashi''': Language of Xerash. #**'''Shemic''': Language group of the ancient non-Nilnameshi pastoralists of the Southwestern Three Seas. #***'''Proto-Caro-Shemic''': Language group of the ancient pastoralists of the Eastern [[Carathay Desert]]. #****'''Caro-Shemic''': Language of the scriptural pastoralists of the Carathay Desert. #*****'''Kianni''': Language of [[Kian]]. #****'''Mamati''': Language of scriptural [[Amoteu]]. #*****'''Amoti''': Language of Amoteu. #*****'''Eumarni''': Language of [[Eumarna]]. #'''Satiothi''': Language group of the [[Satyothi]] peoples. #*'''Aknurmi''': Lost language of ancient [[Zeüm|Angka]]. #**'''Old Zeümi''': Language of ancient Zetim. #***'''Zeümi''': Language of the Empire of Zeüm. #*'''Atkondo-Atyoki''': Language group of the Satyothi pastoralists of the [[Atkondras Mountains]] and surrounding regions. #'''Skaaric''': Language group of the [[Scylvendi]] peoples. #*'''Old Scylvendi''': Language of ancient Scylvendi pastoralists. #**'''Scylvendi''': Language of the Scylvendi. #'''Xiangic''': Language group of the [[Xiuhianni]] peoples (the Lost Nation).
==Languages of Nonmen== Without doubt, the [[Nonmen]], or Cûnuroi, tongues are among the oldest in [[Eärwa]]. Some Aujic inscriptions predate the first extant example of Thoti-Eännorean, ''The Chronicle of the Tusk'', by more than five thousand years. Auja-Gilcûnni, which has yet to be deciphered, is far older still.
#'''Auja-Gilcûnni''': The lost “ground tongue” of the Nonmen. #*'''Aujic''':Lost tongue of the Aujan Mansions. #*'''Ihrimsû''': Tongue of [[Injor-Niyas]]. #*'''Gilcûnya''': Tongue of the Nonmen [[Qûya]] and the [[Gnosis|Gnostic]] [[School|Schools]]. #**'''High Kunna''': Debased version of Gilcûnya, used by the [[Anagogis|Anagogic]] Schools of the [[Three Seas]].
==Other Languages== '''Aghurzoi''' (“Cut Tongue” in Ihrimsû), is the original language of the [[Sranc]]. It is also known as '''Zohurric.'''
'''Cincûlic''' is the undeciphered tongue of the [[Inchoroi]], which the Nonmen called “Cincûl’hisa,” or the “Gasp of Many Reeds.” According to the ''Isûphiryas,'' communication between the Cûnuroi and the Inchoroi was impossible until the latter “birthed mouths” and began speaking Cûnuroi tongues.
==References== ''[[The Darkness That Comes Before]]'', ‘The Major Languages and Dialects of Eärwa’ [[Category:Languages]]

{{Character infobox | name = Mamaradda | titles = Shield-Captain | nicknames = | appearances = | lived = 4071 - 4111 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Ainon]]i | gender = Male | occupation = [[Javreh]] Shield-Captain | relatives = }}
'''Mamaradda''' is the [[Javreh]] Shield-Captain assigned to execute [[Drusas Achamian]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Mamaradda'</ref>
Achamian, freed by his [[Wathi Doll]] from the [[Uroborian Circle]] preventing him from employing [[sorcery]], fights back. Mamaradda is able to resist Achamian's first attack due to holding a [[Chorae]]; however, Achamian forces him to drop it by showering him with hot coals, and then explodes his heart within his chest.<ref>''The Warrior-Prophet'', Chapter 19</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:POV characters]] [[Category:Characters from High Ainon]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Members of the Javreh]]

{{Character infobox | name = Meärji | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4074 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Galeoth]] | gender = Male | occupation = Thane | relatives = }}
'''Meärji''' is a [[Galeoth]] thane, client to Prince [[Coithus Saubon]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Meärji'</ref>
==Story==
===''The Warrior-Prophet''===
Meärji is one of the soldiers who accompanies Saubon and [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]] in the raiding party that infiltrates [[Caraskand]] with the aid of the traitor [[Kepfet ab Tanaj]] and opens the Gate of Horns for the [[Holy War]]<ref>.''The Warrior-Prophet'', Chapter 21</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Thanes]] [[Category:Characters from Galeoth]] [[Category:Norsirai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Meigon | titles = Pragma | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' (flashback only) | lived = 4002 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Dûnyain]] | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = Dûnyain Pragma | relatives = }}
'''Meigon''' is a member of the [[Dûnyain]] [[Pragma]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Meigon'</ref>
Meigon is the Pragma who introduced young [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]] to [[Ishuäl]]'s [[Unmasking Room]] and taught him to read emotions from facial expressions.<ref>''The Warrior Prophet'', Chapter 17</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Dûnyain]] [[Category:Pragma]] [[Category:Characters from Ishuäl]]

{{Character infobox | name = Meümaras | titles = Captain of the ''Amortanea'' | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4058 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Nansur Empire|Nansur]] | gender = Male | occupation = Captain of the ''[[Amortanea]]'' | relatives = Unnamed brother }}
'''Meümaras''' is the Captain of the ''[[Amortanea]].''<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Meümaras’</ref><ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Amortanea’</ref>
He is a ''[[tesperari]],'' a private contractor who once commanded a war galley.
==Appearance== Meümaras’s hair is short and silver. He has no beard and his face, though weathered by the sea, seems boyish.
==Story== ===''The Warrior-Prophet''=== [[Drusas Achamian]] and [[Krijates Xinemus]] hire Meümaras to take them from [[Iothiah]] to [[Caraskand]] on his ship, ''Amortanea.'' On the way, they witness the aftermath of the [[Battle of Trantis Bay]], and Meümaras reveals that he had a brother who died in the battle.<ref>''The Warrior-Prophet,'' Chapter 21</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Ketyai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Opsara | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = 4074 - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = Ketyai | nationality = [[Kian]]ene | gender = Female | occupation = Slave | relatives = }}
'''Opsara''' is a [[Kian]]ene slave who serves as the infant [[Anasûrimbor Moënghus II]]'s wet nurse.<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Opsara'</ref>
==Personality==
Opsara is surly and impertinent, but fiercely devoted to the infant Moënghus.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 2</ref>
==Story==
===''The Thousandfold Thought''===
Opsara is killed by a [[skin-spy]] impersonating [[Fanashila]].<ref>.''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 12</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Slaves]] [[Category:Characters from Kian]] [[Category:Ketyai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Cwithar Ottma | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4073 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Ce Tydonn|Tydonni]] | gender = Male | occupation = Thane
[[Nascenti]] | relatives = }} '''Cwithar Ottma''' is one of the [[Nascenti]], formerly a [[Ce Tydonn|Tydonni]] thane.Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Ottma, Cwithar’ ==References== [[Category:Characters from Ce Tydonn]] [[Category:Nascenti]] [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Thanes]]

{{Character infobox | name = Hagum Persommas | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4078 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Nansur Empire|Nansur]] | gender = Male | occupation = Blacksmith
[[Nascenti]] | relatives = }} '''Hagum Persommas''' is one of the [[Nascenti]], formerly a [[Nansur Empire|Nansur]] blacksmith.Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Persommas, Hagum’ ==References== [[Category:Nascenti]] [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Ketyai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Pilaskanda | titles = King of Girgash | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]''
''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = 4060 - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Girgash]]i | gender = Male | occupation = King of Girgash | relatives = }} '''Pilaskanda''' is the King of [[Girgash]] and a tributary ally of the [[Kian]]ene Padirajah [[Kascamandri ab Tepherokar]].Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Pilaskanda’ ==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Pilaskanda is slain by a spear during the battle of [[Shimeh]].''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 16 ==Trivia== * Pilaskanda’s name is alternately spelled “Pilaskanda” in ''The Warrior-Prophet,'' Chapter 25 and the Encyclopedic Glossary and “Pilasakanda” in ''The Warrior-Prophet,'' Chapter 22. ==References== [[Category:Characters from Girgash]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Kings]]

{{Character infobox | name = Sanathi | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' (mentioned)
''[[The Thousandfold Thought]]'' (mentioned)
''[[The Unholy Consult]]'' (mentioned) | lived = 4100 - ? | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Scylvendi]] | nationality = [[Utemot]] | gender = Female | occupation = | relatives = [[Skiötha urs Hannut|Skiötha]] (grandfather)
[[Cnaiür urs Skiötha's mother|Unnamed grandmother]]

[[Anissi]] (mother)
Thirty-seven unnamed brothers/half-brothers
[[Anasûrimbor Moënghus II|Moënghus]] (half-brother)
[[Maluti]] (cousin) }} '''Sanathi''' was the daughter of [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]] and [[Anissi]]Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Sanathi’. == Story == === ''The Warrior-Prophet'' === When in [[Shigek]], her father thinks about her and her mother, both sleeping far away''The Warrior-Prophet'', Chapter 13. === Life in the New Empire === Sanathi died of unknown causes at some point between 4112 and 4132Encyclopedic Glossary II, 'Sanathi'. ==References== [[Category:Characters from the Steppe]] [[Category:Scylvendi]] [[Category:Utemot]] [[Category:Men]]

{{Character infobox | name = Kemrates Shanipal | image = | caption = | titles = Baron of Hirhamet | nicknames = | lived = 4066 - present | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Conriya]]n | gender = Male | occupation = Baron of [[Hirhamet]] | relatives = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' }}
'''Kemrates Shanipal''' is the Baron of [[Hirhamet]], a district in south central [[Conriya]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Shanipal, Kemrates’</ref>
==Personality== Baron Shanipal is one of those odd men whose graciousness or viciousness depends on how convincingly one caters to his eccentricities.<ref>''The Warrior-Prophet,'' Chapter 20</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Characters from Conriya]] [[Category:Barons]]

'''Seswatha’s Dreams''' are the nightmares experienced by [[Mandate]] Schoolmen of the [[Apocalypse]] as witnessed through [[Seswatha]]’s eyes.<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Dreams, the’</ref>
The Dreams are transferred to each new member of the Mandate through the Grasping, a [[sorcery|sorcerous]] ritual involving Seswatha’s mummified heart.<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Seswatha’s Heart’</ref>
The Dreams are not always identical; small details may vary from time to time, and a Schoolman’s own thoughts can interfere with the Dreams’ content.
The Dreams deal only with the significant experiences of Seswatha during the Apocalypse, omitting mundane details; this has led to a saying among Mandate Schoolmen, “Seswatha does not shit.”<ref>''The Judging Eye,'' Chapter 4</ref> The only known exception to this is the Dreams of [[Drusas Achamian]], which expand over time to include not only mundane events in the life of Seswatha but also events from the life of [[Anasûrimbor Nau-Cayûti]], possible Seswatha’s son.
==References== <references /> [[Category:Magic]] [[Category:Metaphysics]]

'''Hirhamet''' is a district in south central [[Conriya]]<ref name=":0">Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Shanipal, Kemrates’</ref>.
The Baron of Hirhamet at the time of the First Holy War was [[Kemrates Shanipal]]<ref name=":0" />. While Shanipal ruled Conriya in [[Nersei Proyas]]' stead during the time of the [[Great Ordeal]], his son [[Kemrates Danidas]] acted as Baron of Hirhamet<ref>''The Unholy Consult'', Chapter 5</ref>.
==References== <references /> [[Category:Provinces]]

{{Character infobox | name = Sirol ab Kascamandri | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4004 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Kian]]ene | gender = Female | occupation = | relatives = [[Kascamandri ab Tepherokar]] (father)
[[Fanayal ab Kascamandri]] (brother) }} '''Sirol ab Kascamandri''' is the youngest daughter of [[Kascamandri ab Tepherokar]].Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Sirol ab Kascamandri' ==Story== ===''The Warrior-Prophet''=== Sirol is present at the [[Battle of Caraskand]]. When the Padirajah's camp is overrun and her father killed, she is taken away to safety by [[Fanayal ab Kascamandri]].''The Warrior-Prophet'', Chapter 25 ==References== [[Category:Characters from Kian]] [[Category:Ketyai]]

''[[The Thousandfold Thought]]'' (mentioned)
''[[The Unholy Consult]]'' (mentioned) | lived = 4038 - 4079 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Scylvendi]] | nationality = [[Utemot]] | gender = Male | occupation = Chieftain of the [[Utemot]] | relatives = [[Hannut]] (father)

[[Anasûrimbor Moënghus II|Moënghus]] (grandson) }} '''Skiötha urs Hannut''' was the father of [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]], and former Chieftain of the [[Utemot]]. His tribe took [[Anasûrimbor Moënghus]] captive and made him a slaveEncyclopedic Glossary, 'Skiötha urs Hannut'. Cnaiur and Moenghus colluded to get him killed by Moenghus in a challenge. ==References== [[Category:Characters from the Steppe]] [[Category:Scylvendi]] [[Category:Utemot]]

{{Character infobox | name = Nurbanu Soter | titles = Palatine (formerly)
King-Regent | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]''
''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]''
''[[The White-Luck Warrior]]''
''[[The Great Ordeal]]''
''[[The Unholy Consult]]'' | lived = 4069 - present? | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[High Ainon|Ainoni]] | gender = Male | occupation = Palatine of [[Kishyat]] (formerly)
King-Regent of [[High Ainon]] | relatives =[[Nurbanu Ze|Ze]] (adoptive son) }} '''Nurbanu Soter''' is the King-Regent of [[High Ainon]]Encyclopedic Glossary II, 'Soter, Nurbanu' (formerly the Palatine of [[Kishyat]])Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Soter, Nurbanu’ and a veteran of the [[Holy War|First Holy War]]''The White-Luck Warrior'', Chapter 2. He was the leader of the Ainoni contingent in Anasûrimbor Kellhus' [[Great Ordeal]]. == Personality == Soter is renowned for his "pious cruelty" and "pragmatic brutality", particularly during the [[Unification Wars]]. He is also a bellicose man by nature''The Unholy Consult'', Chapter 15. ==Story== === ''The Warrior-Prophet'' === At the [[Battle of Anwurat]], the Kishyati under Soter fought off several charges from the Grandees of [[Eumarna]], purchasing time for the other Ainoni knights''The Warrior-Prophet'', Chapter 14. ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== As the [[Holy War]] marched for [[Shimeh]], Soter and his Kishyati knights ran down refugees on the [[Herotic Way]] for sport''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 4. Using the Herotic Way, Soter and his Kishyati were later the first to eventually spy the black walls of [[Gerotha]] and strike up the first camp of the siege''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 8. After [[Coithus Athjeäri]] was killed, the twenty surviving Thanes and Knights of [[Gaenri]] were rescued from their pursuers by a band of Kishyati led by Soter''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 11. During the battle for [[Shimeh]], Soter led his Kishyati in a "desperate charge" from the north''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 16. Later in the battle, they fought the forces led by [[Cinganjehoi ab Sakjal]], managing to drive them back and ensuring their defeat by the [[Moserothu|Moserothi]] under [[Sirpal Uranyanka]]. === The Unification Wars === Soter distinguished himself during the Unification Wars, for which he was rewarded by being declared King-Regent of High Ainon in 4121Encyclopedic Glossary II, 'Unification Wars'. At some point between the conquest of Shimeh in 4112 and the beginning of the Great Ordeal's march in 4132, Soter adopted [[Nurbanu Ze]] as his son. It is likely this event took place during the Unification Wars. === ''The White-Luck Warrior'' === Following the division of the Ordeal into the Four Armies, Soter led the Ainoni contingent of the army of the [[Ketyai]] of the East. Later, [[Halas Siroyon]] coordinated his expeditions to assess the progress of the [[Sranc]] Horde with Soter''The White-Luck Warrior'', Chapter 7. When [[Heramari Iyokus]] argued that the [[School|Schools]] should abandon the [[Culling]], Soter argued it was necessary it should continue, or else the Ordeal would not survive long enough to reach the [[Neleöst|Neleöst Sea]]''The White-Luck Warrior'', Chapter 10. === ''The Great Ordeal'' === As [[Nersei Proyas]] relentlessly begged Anasûrimbor Kellhus for the command of the forces to be sent to [[Dagliash]], he noticed Soter and [[Hringa Vûkyelt]], among others, frowning at his infraction''The Great Ordeal'', Chapter 10. === ''The Unholy Consult'' === When [[Anasûrimbor Serwa]] and [[Varalt Sorweel III|Varalt Sorweel]] returned to the Great Ordeal, Soter fell to Serwa's knees crying and asking what was happening to them''The Unholy Consult'', Chapter 8. After Nersei Proyas was denounced as a traitor, he noticed Soter's expression of demented outrage as he was being strung up''The Unholy Consult'', Chapter 9. During the Last Whelming, Kellhus recalled the conversation he had with [[Nemukus Mirshoa]], one of Soter's vassals, addressing the King-Regent directly as well''The Unholy Consult'', Chapter 12. [[Anasûrimbor Kelmomas]] later noticed Soter among the Lords of the Ordeal gathered to kiss his father's knee. For the attack on [[Golgotterath]] itself, the Ordeal was divided into three Trials''The Unholy Consult'', Chapter 14. Soter was given command of the Sons of Shir, who were charged with taking the Tower of [[Corrunc]]. During the battle for Golgotterath, Soter and his men were the first to assemble beneath the turrets of the High Cwol, shortly before the pulses from the [[Sun Lance]] began targeting the sorcerers and witches in their midst. In the chaos that followed, Soter and his Ainoni abandoned the mages to their fate and proceeded to storm the bastions and corridors of the High Cwol. After Serwa reencountered the rest of the Ordeal following her injury by a pulse of the Sun Lance, she found her brother [[Anasûrimbor Kayûtas|Kayûtas]] standing alongside Soter and [[Apperens Saccarees]]''The Unholy Consult'', Chapter 17. As Soter was not mentioned again following this event, it is unknown if he survived the battle or the destruction of the remainder of the Ordeal by the rise of the [[No-God]]. ==References== [[Category:Characters from High Ainon]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Palatines]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Great Ordeal]]

{{Character infobox | name = Gishtari Therishut | titles = Baron | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4067 - 4111 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Conriya]]n | gender = Male | occupation = Baron | relatives = }}
'''Gishtari Therishut''' is a [[Conriya]]n Baron from the [[High Ainon|Ainon]]i frontier, murdered by persons unknown.<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Therishut, Gishtari’</ref>
==Appearance== Therishut has a thin beard.<ref>''The Warrior-Prophet,'' Chapter 12</ref>
==Story== ===''The Warrior-Prophet''=== After the [[Holy War]] captures [[Shigek]], Therishut informs [[Krijates Xinemus]] about the discovery of books related to the [[Gnosis]] in the [[Sareötic Library]]. Xinemus then passes the information to [[Drusas Achamian]], who travels there only to discover it to be a trap set by the [[Scarlet Spires]].
==References== <references /> [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Characters from Conriya]] [[Category:Barons]]

{{Character infobox | name = Shaugar Ulnarta | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4071 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Ce Tydonn|Tydonni]] | gender = Male | occupation = Thane
[[Nascenti]] | relatives = }} '''Shaugar Ulnarta''' is one of the [[Nascenti]], formermly a [[Ce Tydonn|Tydonni]] thane.Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Ulnarta, Shaugar’ ==References== [[Category:Thanes]] [[Category:Characters from Ce Tydonn]] [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Nascenti]]

{{Character infobox | name = Sirpal Uranyanka | titles = Palatine-Governor of Moserothu | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]''
''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = 4062 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[High Ainon|Ainon]]i | gender = Male | occupation = Palatine-Governor of [[Moserothu]] | relatives = }} '''Sirpal Uranyanka''' is the Palatine-Governor of the [[High Ainon|Ainon]]i city of [[Moserothu]].Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Uranyanka, Sirpal’ ==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== As the [[Holy War]] marches on [[Shimeh]], [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]] has Uranyanka flogged for ordering his archers to massacre an enclave of lepers near the town of [[Sabotha]].''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 4 ==References== [[Category:Palatines]] [[Category:Characters from High Ainon]] [[Category:Ketyai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Utgarangi ab Hoularji | titles = Sapatishah-Governor | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = 4059 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Xerash]]i | gender = Male | occupation = Sapatishah-Governor of Xerash | relatives = }}
'''Utgarangi ab Hoularji''' is Sapatishah-Governor of [[Xerash]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Utgarangi ab Hoularji'</ref>
==Story==
===''The Warrior-Prophet''===
During the siege of [[Caraskand]] by the [[Holy War]], a splinter force of several thousand men led by [[Coithus Athjeäri]] enters Xerash. Athjeäri routs Utgarangi's army and captures him. In exchange for his release to the capital, [[Gerotha]], Utgarangi provides Athjeäri with five hundred horses and valuable military intelligence.
===''The Thousandfold Thought''===
Utgarangi escapes from Gerotha shortly before it comes under siege by the Holy War.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 8</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Sapatishahs]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Characters from Kian]]

{{Character infobox | name = Nostol | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - ? | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Meöri]] | gender = Male | occupation = Warrior | relatives = }}
'''Nostol''' was a [[Meöri]] hero who lived during the time of the [[Apocalypse]].
In 2151, after the collapse of the Meöri Empire, Nostol and a band of his followers allied with [[Gin'yursis]], the [[Nonman]] King of [[Cil-Aujas]]. Together, they held back the Horde of the [[No-God]] at the [[Battle of Kathol Pass]], which would be humanity's only victory during the Years of the Crib. However, the [[Men]] resented their Nonmen allies, and the following year betrayed and killed the Nonmen of Cil-Aujas.<ref>The Judging Eye, Chapter 11</ref>
Nostol and his followers would go on to become the forefathers of the [[Galeoth]]. Common legend holds that the famous fractiousness of the Galeoth is due to a curse placed on the traitorous Nostol and his followers by Gin'yursis. In actuality, Gin'yursis was not so discriminate in his dying; he cursed all Men.<ref>The Judging Eye, Chapter 11</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Characters from the Ancient North]]

{{Character infobox | name = Oirinas | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - ? | race = [[Nonmen]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Siöl]] | gender = Male | occupation = Warrior | relatives = [[Oirûnas]] (brother) }}
'''Oirinas''' is a [[Nonman]] mentioned in the ''[[Isûphiryas]]'' who fought in the [[Cûno-Inchoroi Wars]].
Oirinas and his twin [[Oirûnas]] were members of the First Watch on the [[Incû-Holoinas]]. When the [[Inchoroi]] attacked, Oirinas and Oirûnas were the only two survivors, and rode hard to warn [[Cû’jara-Cinmoi]].
After the [[Battle of Pir Pahal]], the two were assigned the duty of recruiting [[Men]] for the Second Watch.
Oirinas and Oirûnas later engaged the Inchoroi once more on the [[Inniür-Shigogli]], where Oirinas was slain.<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, Cûno-Inchoroi Wars</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Cûnuroi]] [[Category:Characters from the Ancient North]] [[Category:Ishroi]]

{{Character infobox | name = Oirûnas | titles = Lord of the Watch | nicknames = | appearances = "[[The Great Ordeal]]" | lived = ? - present | race = [[Nonmen]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Siöl]] | gender = Male | occupation = Warrior | relatives = [[Oirinas]] (brother)
[[Oinaral]] (son) }} {{Blockquote|I suffer but one disorder.|Oirûnas' one-liner}} '''Oirûnas''' is a [[Nonman]] hero who fought in the [[Cûno-Inchoroi Wars]] and is currently imprisoned in the deeps of [[Ishterebinth]]. He is the father of another famed Nonman hero, [[Oinaral]] Lastborn. Oirûnas and his twin [[Oirinas]] were members of the First Watch on the [[Incû-Holoinas]]. When the [[Inchoroi]] attacked, Oirinas and Oirûnas were the only two survivors, and rode hard to warn [[Cû’jara-Cinmoi]]. After the [[Battle of Pir Pahal]], the two were assigned the duty of recruiting [[Men]] for the Second Watch. Oirûnas succumbed to the Dolour and confined himself to the Deep. Later Oinaral and Sorweel used him to cleanse Ishterebinth from the Vile. Oinaral sacrificed himself so the old warrior would regain his facilities. Oirûnas killed [[Harapior]] with his sword and burned [[Nin'ciljiras]] alive, starting the war between the Ishroi of the Weeping Mountain. ==References== [[Category:Cûnuroi]] [[Category:Characters from the Ancient North]] [[Category:Ishroi]]
