'''''The Limping Pilgrim''''' is a work by [[Teres Ansansius]], the most famed theologian of the early [[Thousand Temples]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Ansansius, Teres'</ref>
==Excerpts==
"The world has its own ways, sockets so deep that not even the [[Gods]] can dislodge them. No urn is so cracked at Fate."<ref>''The White-Luck Warrior'', Chapter 5</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Religious texts]] [[Category:Written works]]

'''''Parapolis''''' is a work by the great [[Ûmeri Empire|Ûmeri]] [[sorcerer]] [[Gotagga]].
==Excerpts== “The truth of all polity lies in the ruins of previous ages, for there we see the ultimate sum of avarice and ambition. Seek ye to rule for but a day, because little more shall be afforded you. As the [[Siqû]] are fond of saying, [[Cû’jara-Cinmoi]] is dead.” <ref>''The White-Luck Warrior,'' Chapter 14</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Written works]]

{{Character infobox | name = Sancla | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' (flashback only) | lived = 4064 - 4083 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = [[Mandate]] [[sorcerer]] | relatives = }}
'''Sancla''' was [[Drusas Achamian]]’s cellmate and lover during his adolescence in [[Atyersus]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Sancla’</ref>
Sancla was killed in [[Aöknyssus]] by a drunken [[caste]]-noble with a [[Chorae]].<ref>''The Warrior-Prophet,'' Chapter 12</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Mandate]] [[Category:Characters from the Three Seas]] [[Category:Gnostic sorcerers]]

A '''Shaman''' is defined in ''[[The Chronicle of the Tusk]]'' as a man who is both a prophet and a [[sorcerer]].<ref>''The Warrior-Prophet'', Chapter 12</ref>
[[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]] becomes the first Shaman in thousands of years when he learns the [[Gnosis]] from [[Drusas Achamian]].
==References== <references/> [[Category:Occupations]] [[Category:Magic]] [[Category:Religion]]

{{Character infobox | name = Titirga | image = | caption = | titles = Archidemu Sohoncu | nicknames = Hero-Mage, Glorious Pupil, Titirga Mithalara (Giver of Mercy) | lived = ? - 1119 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Cond]] | gender = Male | occupation = Grandmaster | relatives = | appearances = ''[[The False Sun]]'' }}
'''Titirga''' was the Archideme of the [[School]] of [[Sohonc]]. One of the most powerful sorcerers ever to have lived in [[Eärwa]], even surpassing most of the [[Nonmen]]. He was killed by [[Shaeönanra]] and [[Aurang]] in 1119 ([[Year-of-the-Tusk]]).<ref name="fs">''[[The False Sun]]''</ref>
==Character and appearance== Titirga was tall and broad shouldered, with a shallow nose and thick brows and cheeks. His hair was white, although it is implied that it was originally golden. He had a bronzed skull of an infant child braided into his beard as a totem. Titirga carried with him a [[Sorcery|sorcerous]] artifact known as the [[False Sun]], which was given to him by the Nonman [[Emilidis]].<ref name="fs" />
{{Blockquote|They said he had been blind as a child, that [[Noshainrau]] himself had found him begging in the streets. They said he went mad while Canting. They said his words seized things that should not be seized.|Shaeönanra about Titirga<ref name="fs" />}}
'''From 'The False Sun'''': He wore a Pircondi cloak over his black woolen robes, two wolfskins sewn together, so that the tailings of the face fluttered side-by-side below his groin. His hair was white spun with the odd memory of gold. But it was his high blunt face that commanded attention: shallow of nose, thick of brow and cheek.
And of course the bronzed skull of an infant child braided into his beard–his famed totem.
==Story== ==='''''The False Sun'''''=== [[File:FalseSun.jpg|thumb|300px|The Glorious Pupil, Titirga, Grandmaster of the Sohonc, shines the famed Day Lantern on Shaeönanra, Grandmaster of the Mangaecca and dread leader of the Unholy Consult.]] Titirga visits the tower of [[Nogaral]], the stronghold of the School of [[Mangaecca]], carrying his False Sun. He plans to deliver an ultimatum to the Archideme of the Mangaecca, [[Shaeönanra]], who awaits him at the tower. Titirga says that the reason for his visit is that he'd heard rumors that the Mangaecca had ''found'' something, referring to the [[Incû-Holoinas|Ark]] of the [[Inchoroi]]. Shaeönanra reminds him that the Ark is sealed and hidden by a glamour, implying that it cannot be entered. In truth, Shaeönanra, had already broken the glamour about the Ark and entered it.
Shaeönanra leads Titirga down the reception hall and into an expansive hub inside Nogaral called [[Asinna]]. Titirga senses someone beneath him, someone deeply stained with the [[Mark]] of sorcery. Shaeönanra offers to make the person withdraw but Titirga insists that he remains close so that he can keep his eye on him. Then Shaeönanra summons their 'guest', [[Aurang]], an Inchoroi. Titirga calls the thing obscene.
Aurang asks Titirga whether he fears damnation, Titirga replies that the Nonmen taught him to hide his voice in order to bypass the [[Outside]] and find oblivion, in other words, he worships the spaces between the Gods. Aurang tells him that he is damned according to the [[Inverse Fire]]. Titiga says that the Inverse Fire is nothing but a 'goad'. He says that the Mangaecca have been enslaved by the [[Tekne]].
Shaeönanra, finally fed up with arguing, asks Titirga to reveal the real reason he's there, Tiriga says that he has come to kill the Inchoroi. But the floor beneath him suddenly drops and Titirga falls into a vast pit called the [[Viritic Well]].<ref name="fs" />
==References== <references /> [[Category:Grandmasters]] [[Category:Characters from the Ancient North]] [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Sohonc]] [[Category:Gnostic sorcerers]]

{{Character infobox | name = Ankaryotis | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]'' | lived = | race = [[Ciphrang]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = | occupation = Potent | relatives = }}
'''Ankaryotis''' is a [[Ciphrang]], a divine agency (demon) of the [[Outside]] and one of the more manageable Potents controlled by the [[Scarlet Spires]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Ankaryotis’</ref>
==Appearance== Ankaryotis takes material form as a writhing abomination with “scales like knives and limbs like iron pillars.”<ref>''The Warrior-Prophet,'' Chapter 19</ref> The demon’s large head is described as “elephantine” and it has “a great maw ringed by eyes.”
==Story== ===''The Warrior-Prophet''=== When [[Drusas Achamian]] escapes his imprisonment by the Scarlet Spires, [[Heramari Iyokus]] summons Ankaryotis to kill him. The two fight, and Achamian eventually defeats Ankaryotis, sending the demon back to the Outside.
==References== <references /> [[Category:Ciphrang]] [[Category:Characters from the Outside]]
#redirect [[Meümaras]]

{{Character infobox | name = Fanashila | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = 4092 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Kian]]ene | gender = Female | occupation = Body-slave | relatives = }}
'''Fanashila''' is one of [[Esmenet]]'s [[Kian]]ene body-slaves.<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, 'Fanashila'</ref>
==Personality==
Fanashila is outspoken and earnest.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 2</ref>
==Story==
===''The Thousandfold Thought''===
Fanashila is killed by a [[skin-spy]] impersonating [[Sainhail Werjau]], and subsequently replaced.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 10</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:POV characters]] [[Category:Characters from Kian]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Slaves]]

{{Stub}} {{Character_infobox |name = Meppa |nicknames = Stonebreaker |appearances = ''[[The Judging Eye (Book) | Judging Eye]]''
''[[The White-Luck Warrior (Book) | The White-Luck Warrior]]'' |lived =? - ? |race = Men |nationality = [[Indara-Kishauri]] |gender = Male}} Meppa is the last remaining [[Cishaurim]] at the time of the [[Aspect-Emperor|Aspect-Emperor series]]. Who he was before this point is unknown as he suffers from amnesia. He currently accompanies [[Fanayal ab Kascamandri]], to whom he is totally loyal. Meppa commands the [[Psûkhe]] at the level of a Primary, or greater. He wears a silver band covering his upper face to hide the fact that he is eyeless.The White-Luck Warrior, Chapter 5 ==Story== ===The Judging Eye=== ===The White-Luck Warrior=== ===The Unholy Consult=== ==References== [[Category:Cishaurim]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Characters from Kian]]

{{Character infobox | name = Hertata | titles = | nicknames = Hertata-tata
Echo | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Nansur]] | gender = Male | occupation = Prostitute | relatives = }} '''Hertata''' is an orphan boy who lives in [[Sumna]]. He always repeats the last words of his sentences, which has resulted in him gaining derogatory nicknames such as Hertata-tata and Echo. Hertata prostitutes himself for food because he is too afraid to steal.''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 4 ==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Hertata convinces his friend [[Sol]] to come with him to the stone quay to see the departure of [[Maithanet]], whom Hertata reveres. Sol is concerned with the danger posed by slavers, who hold their markets at the quay, but Hertata believes they will not show themselves in the presence of Maithanet for fear of being damned. At the Shrial Procession, Hertata catches Maithanet’s eye and the Shriah smiles at him. When he turns to leave, Hertata is then captured by a slaver, though Sol escapes. ==References== [[Category:Prostitutes]] [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Slaves]]

'''Naïth''' is a walled town located high in the foothills of the [[Betmulla Mountains]].
During the [[Holy War]], Naïth is burned to the ground by [[Murworg Ganbrota]] and the [[Ingraul]]ish under his command.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 4</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Cities]]

'''Kijenicho''' is a great fortress located in [[Kian]] on the coast of the [[Meneanor|Meneanor Sea]].
During the [[Holy War]], Earl [[Iyengar]] and the [[Nangael]]s under his command take the fortress and throw the garrison off the walls.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 4</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Structures]]

revision.comment: Replaced Kian with Xerash, as the location of the town. More precise.
revision.text:
'''Sabotha''' is a town in [[Xerash]].
During the [[Holy War]], [[Sirpal Uranyanka]] orders his archers to massacre an enclave of lepers near Sabotha, an offense for which [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]] has him flogged.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 4</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Cities]]

The '''Surdu''' are a band of tribesmen native to [[Enathpaneah]].
The Surdu preserved their [[Inrithi]] traditions for centuries after Enathpaneah fell to the [[Fanim]]. When the [[Holy War]] marches on Shimeh, a number of Surdu offer to join the Holy War and guide them through the [[Betmulla Mountains]]. However, [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]] senses deception, and it is subsequently revealed that Padirajah [[Fanayal ab Kascamandri]] abducted their wives and children to compel them to join and then betray the Holy War. Kellhus has the Surdu men publically flayed<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 4, p. 87</ref>.
==References== <references/> [[Category:Tribes]]

{{Character infobox | name = Darastius | titles = | nicknames = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | appearances = | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = [[Imperial Saik]] [[sorcerer]] | relatives = }}
'''Darastius''' is a [[sorcerer]] of the [[Imperial Saik]].
==Story==
===''The Thousandfold Thought''===
Darastius is one of those who accompanies [[Ikurei Conphas]] when he is expelled from [[Caraskand]] by [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]]. [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]] orders his own sorcerer, [[Saurnemmi]], to identify any sorcerers among Conphas’s men. Saurnemmi points out Darastias, whom Cnaiür kills with a [[Chorae]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 5</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Imperial Saik]] [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Anagogic sorcerers]]

The '''Shiropti''' are descendants of those [[Shigek]]i who had fled following the [[Nansur Empire|Nansur]] Imperial Army’s disastrous defeat at [[Huparna]] centuries before.
They have a reputation as thieves and usurers.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 5</ref>
==Members== * [[Cememketri]]
==References== <references /> [[Category:Tribes]]

{{Character infobox | name = Zioz | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = | race = [[Ciphrang]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = | occupation = Potent | relatives = }} [[File:Akka v Zioz.jpg|thumb|300px|The Mandate sorcerer Drusas Achamian sings the Gnosis against the Ciphrang lord Zioz.]]
'''Zioz''' is a [[Ciphrang]], a divine agency (demon) of the [[Outside]], controlled by the [[Scarlet Spires]].
Zioz is strong-willed and therefore very dangerous to summon.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 14</ref> [[Hanamanu Eleäzaras]] regards the demon as too risky to use.
==Appearance== Zioz is an incorporeal being in the normal state, but takes a material form with “a face like summer sunlight and limbs barked in fire.”<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 16</ref>
==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== In preparation for the attack on [[Shimeh]], [[Heramari Iyokus]] summons Zioz and sends it to attack the [[Cishaurim]]. This forces the Cishaurim to redistribute their [[Chorae]] to guard against further incursions by Ciphrang, reducing the number that will be available for use against the Scarlet Spires during the main assault.
==References== <references /> [[Category:POV characters]] [[Category:Ciphrang]] [[Category:Characters from the Outside]]

{{Character infobox | name = Fanfarokar | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Indara-Kishauri]] | gender = Male | occupation = [[Cishaurim]] | relatives = }}
'''Fanfarokar''' is one of the Nine Incandati, the most powerful of the [[Cishaurim]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 16</ref>
==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== During the battle for [[Shimeh]], Fanfarokar battles [[Hanamanu Eleäzaras]]. He is killed by [[Yalgrota Sranchammer]] when [[Thunyerus|Thunyeri]] under [[Hringa Hulwarga]] come to Eleäzaras’s aid.
==References== <references /> [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Cishaurim]] [[Category:Characters from Kian]]

{{Character infobox | name = Inkorot | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Indara-Kishauri]] | gender = Male | occupation = [[Cishaurim]] | relatives = }}
'''Inkorot''' is one of the Nine Incandati, the most powerful of the [[Cishaurim]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 16</ref>
==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== During the battle for [[Shimeh]], Inkorot battles [[Sarosthenes]].
==References== <references /> [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Cishaurim]] [[Category:Characters from Kian]]

{{Character infobox | name = Hab’hara | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Indara-Kishauri]] | gender = Male | occupation = [[Cishaurim]] | relatives = }}
'''Hab’hara''' is one of the Nine Incandati, the most powerful of the [[Cishaurim]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 16</ref>
==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Hab’hara fights, and is eventually slain, in the battle for [[Shimeh]].
==References== <references /> [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Cishaurim]] [[Category:Characters from Kian]]

{{Character infobox | name = Seökti | titles = Heresiarch of the Cishaurim | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = 4051 - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Indara-Kishauri]] | gender = Male | occupation = Heresiarch of the [[Cishaurim]] | relatives = }}
'''Seökti''' is the Heresiarch of the [[Cishaurim]].<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Seökti’</ref>
==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Seökti fights in the battle for [[Shimeh]]. He slays [[Hanamanu Eleäzaras]], then is himself killed by [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]].
==References== <references /> [[Category:Cishaurim]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Characters from Kian]]

{{Character infobox | name = Sarosthenes | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[High Ainon|Ainon]]i | gender = Male | occupation = [[Scarlet Spires]] [[sorcerer]] | relatives = }} '''Sarosthenes''' is a [[sorcerer]] of the [[Scarlet Spires]] who was the first Scarlet Schoolman to set foot in the city during the battle for [[Shimeh]].''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 15
==Trivia== * Sarosthenes name is alternately spelled “Sarosthenes” in ''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapters 11 and 16 and “Sarothenes” in ''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapters 2 and 15. ==References== [[Category:Characters from High Ainon]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Scarlet Spires]] [[Category:Anagogic sorcerers]]
#redirect [[Sarosthenes]]

{{Character infobox | name = Ti | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Ainon]]i | gender = Male | occupation = [[Scarlet Spires]] [[sorcerer]] | relatives = }}
'''Ti''' is a [[sorcerer]] of the [[Scarlet Spires]] who fights in the battle for [[Shimeh]].
Despite his advanced age, he continually scolds his [[Javreh]] for their sloth.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 15</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Characters from High Ainon]] [[Category:Scarlet Spires]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Anagogic sorcerers]]

{{Character infobox | name = Agnaras | titles = Captain in the Imperial Army | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = Captain in the Imperial Army | relatives = }}
'''Agnaras''' is a Captain in the Imperial Army and a follower of [[Ikurei Conphas]].
==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Agnaras accompanies [[Biaxi Sompas]] in hunting for [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]] after his escape from [[Joktha]]. After catching up to the fugitive [[Scylvendi]], he is killed by a [[Skin-spies|skin-spy]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 13</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Members of the Imperial Army]]

{{Character infobox | name = Anasûrimbor Huörmomas | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Kûniüri]] | gender = Men | occupation = | relatives = [[Anasûrimbor Celmomas II]] (brother) }}
'''Anasûrimbor Huörmomas''' was the stillborn twin brother of [[Anasûrimbor Celmomas II]].
According to ''[[The Sagas]]'', Celmomas was haunted by thoughts of Huörmomas throughout his life.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 8</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Anasûrimbor]] [[Category:Characters from Kûniüri]] [[Category:Norsirai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Areamanteras | titles = General | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Nansur]] | gender = Male | occupation = General of the Nasueret Column | relatives = }}
'''Areamanteras''' is the General of the Nasueret Column of the [[Nansur]] Imperial Army.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 7</ref>
A loyal follower of [[Ikurei Conphas]], he is killed by [[Drusas Achamian]] during the battle for [[Shimeh]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 16</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Members of the Imperial Army]]

{{Character infobox | name = Aspa Memkumri | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Ainon]]i | gender = Male | occupation = Client of [[Sirpal Uranyanka]] | relatives = }}
'''Aspa Memkumri''' is a client of [[Sirpal Uranyanka]] and member of the [[Holy War]].
He is killed by the [[Scarlet Spires]] in [[Caraskand]] after the [[Battle of Caraskand]] for unknown reasons<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 2</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Characters from High Ainon]]

{{Character infobox | name = Ysanna | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Darkness That Comes Before]]'' | lived = ? - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Female | occupation = Slave | relatives = }}
'''Ysanna''' is a slave belonging to the Gaunum family. She helped in the gardens until the Patridomos decided she was too beautiful to be wasted on such work.
She is taken captive when [[Scylvendi]] under [[Panteruth urs Mutkius]] raid the Gaunum household, but is set free when Panteruth is killed by [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]] and [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]].<ref>''The Darkness That Comes Before'', Chapter 13</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Slaves]] [[Category:Characters from the Three Seas]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Concubines]]

{{Character infobox | name = Ûssirta | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - | race = [[Skin-spies|Skin-spy]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = [[Consult]] spy | relatives = }}
'''Ûssirta''' is a [[Consult]] [[Skin-spies|skin-spy]].
==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Prior to the battle for [[Shimeh]], it receives instruction from [[Aurang]] regarding a plan to prevent [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]] from obtaining the [[Gnosis]] by assassinating his teacher, [[Drusas Achamian]]. However, Ûssirta does not directly participate in the endeavour. The attack is carried out by a different skin-spy, which fails and dies in the attempt.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 11</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Characters from Golgotterath]] [[Category:Skin-spies]] [[Category:Consult members]]

{{Character infobox | name = Umartu | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - ? | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Shiradi Empire|Shiradic]] | gender = Male | occupation = Philosopher | relatives = }}
'''Umartu''' was an ancient [[Shiradi Empire|Shiradic]] philosopher.
==Writings==
"All the world repeats. Know these repetitions, and you may intervene."<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 11</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Characters from the Shiradi Empire]] [[Category:Philosophers]] [[Category:Norsirai]]
#redirect [[Ûssirta]]

{{Character infobox | name = Beotha Tuthorsa | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]''
''[[The Unholy Consult]]'' (mentioned) | lived = 4089 - 4121 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity =[[Norsirai]] | nationality =[[Ce Tydonn|Tydonni]] | gender = Male | occupation = Soldier | relatives = }} '''Beotha''' '''Tuthorsa''' was a member of the [[Holy War]]. He was a devout believer in the divinity of [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]], and assisted in the expulsion of [[Ikurei Conphas]] from [[Caraskand]]''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 3. Tuthorsa died of unknown causes in 4121Encyclopedic Glossary II, 'Tûthorsa, Beotha'. == Trivia == His name is spelled "Tûthorsa" in his entry in the encyclopedic glossary at the end of ''[[The Unholy Consult]]''. ==References== [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Characters from the Three Seas]] [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Characters from Ce Tydonn]]

{{Character infobox | name = Troyatti | titles = Captain | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Conriya]]n | gender = Male | occupation = Captain of the [[Hemscilvara]] | relatives = }}
'''Troyatti''' is Captain of the [[Hemscilvara]].
He accompanies [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]] in escorting [[Ikurei Conphas]] to [[Joktha]] after his expulsion from [[Caraskand]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 7</ref>
Conphas escapes from Joktha, joins with reinforcements, and takes the city. Troyatti is slain along with all of the defenders save Cnaiür.
==References== <references/> [[Category:Characters from Conriya]] [[Category:Ketyai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Tirnemus | titles = Baron | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = Baron | relatives = }}
'''Tirnemus''' is a Baron and member of the [[Holy War]]. Along with Baron [[Sanumnis]], he commands 370 client knights.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 5</ref>
==Personality== Tirnemus is an outright fool, more concerned with eating well than his job.
==Story==
===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Tirnemus, Sanumnis, and their client knights accompany [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]] in escorting [[Ikurei Conphas]] to [[Joktha]] after his expulsion from [[Caraskand]]. When Conphas escapes from Joktha, joins with reinforcements, and takes the city, Tirnemus is among the defenders slain.
==References== <references/> [[Category:Barons]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Characters from the Three Seas]]

{{Character infobox | name = Tatokar I | titles = High Heresiarch of the Cishaurim | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - ? | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Indara-Kishauri]] | gender = Male | occupation = High Heresiarch of the [[Cishaurim]] | relatives = }}
'''Tatokar I''' was a High Heresiarch of the [[Cishaurim]].
Tatokar was responsible for adding white-glazed tile to the exterior walls of [[Shimeh]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 13</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Characters from Kian]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Cishaurim]]

{{Character infobox | name = Hahkti ab Sibban | titles = High Heresiarch of the Cishaurim | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - ? | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Indara-Kishauri]] | gender = Male | occupation = Poet
High Heresiarch of the [[Cishaurim]] | relatives = }} '''Hahkti ab Sibban''' was a famed poet and the successor of [[Tatokar I]] as Heresiarch of the [[Cishaurim]].''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 13 He was responsible for the towering eyes that adorn the outer walls of [[Shimeh]]. Asked for an explanation, he reportedly said that they were intended to remind idolators that the [[Solitary God]] does not blink. ==References== [[Category:Cishaurim]] [[Category:Poets]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Characters from Kian]]

{{Character infobox | name = Sanumnis | titles = Baron | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Conriya]]n | gender = Male | occupation = Conriyan Baron | relatives = }}
'''Sanumnis''' is a [[Conriya]]n Baron and member of the [[Holy War]]. Along with Baron [[Tirnemus]], he commands 370-odd client knights.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 5</ref>
==Personality== Sanumnis is clever and taciturn.
==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Sanumnis, Tirnemus, and their client knights accompany [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]] in escorting [[Ikurei Conphas]] to [[Joktha]] after his expulsion from Caraskand. When Conphas escapes from Joktha, joins with reinforcements, and takes the city, Sanumnis is among the defenders slain.
==References== <references /> [[Category:Barons]] [[Category:Characters from Conriya]] [[Category:Ketyai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Tarempas | titles = Admiral | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Nansur]] | gender = Male | occupation = Admiral of the Nansur Fleet | relatives = }}
'''Tarempas''' is the Admiral of the [[Nansur]] Fleet.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 7</ref>
==Appearance== Tarempas is a restless, small-statured man whose eyes constantly dart about his surroundings.
==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Tarempas brings transports to [[Joktha]] carrying reinforcements for [[Ikurei Conphas]], including [[sorcerer]]s of the [[Imperial Saik]].
==References== <references /> [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Men]]

'''''Ode to the Long-Lived Fool''''' is a work by [[Managoras]].
==Excerpts== “If you find yourself taken unawares by someone you thought you knew, recall that the character revealed is as much your own as otherwise. When it comes to [[Men]] and their myriad, mercenary natures, revelation always comes in twos.”<ref>''The White-Luck Warrior,'' Chapter 6</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Written works]]

'''''The Virtue of Sin''''' is a work by [[Merotokas]].
==Excerpts==
"This one thing every tyrant will tell you: nothing saves more lives than murder."{{5|11}}
==References== <references /> [[Category:Written works]]

'''''Epimeditations''''' is a work by [[Suörtagal]].
==Excerpts==
"The heroes among us, they are the true slaves. Thrust against the limits of mortality, they alone feel the bite of their shackles. So they rage. So they fight. We only have as much freedom as we have slack in our chains. Only those who dare nothing are truly free."<ref>''The White-Luck Warrior'', Interlude, p. 581</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Written works]]

{{Character infobox | name = Su’juroit | titles = Witch-King | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - ? | race = [[Nonmen]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = [[Qûya]] | relatives = }} [[File:Witch king by spiralhorizon-d7wtz8m.jpg|thumb|300px|Su’juroit, the great Nonman Witch-King. Only mentioned once, and probably not to be featured again in the narrative, but evokes a mysterious character nonetheless.]] '''Su’juroit''' was a [[Nonmen|Nonman]] [[Qûya]] who was capable of using [[Gnosis|Gnostic]] cants with not merely the two standard strings (one utteral, one inutteral), but rather three strings (one utteral, two inutteral).
Stories of Su’juroit were passed down to [[Men]] during the [[Nonman Tutelage]], but he is considered a myth by most users of the Gnosis.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 6</ref> Three-phrase “metagnostic” cants would not be used again for thousands of years, until their rediscovery by [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]].
==References== <references /> [[Category:Qûya]] [[Category:Cûnuroi]] [[Category:Characters from the Ancient North]] [[Category:Kings]]

{{Character infobox | name = Sol | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = 4101 - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Nansur]] | gender = Male | occupation = Thief | relatives = }}
'''Sol''' is an orphan who lives in the city of [[Sumna]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 4</ref>
==Story==
===''The Thousandfold Thought''===
Sol is convinced by his friend and fellow orphan [[Hertata]] to travel to Sumna’s stone quays to see the departure of [[Maithanet]], whom Hertata reveres. Sol is concern by the danger of slavers, who hold their markets in the quays, but Hertata believes that no one would dare sin in Maithanet’s presence for fear of being damned. The two boys attend the procession, and Maithanet smiles in Hertata’s direction. After the procession, Hertata is captured by a slaver, but Sol is fast enough to escape.
==References== <references /> [[Category:POV characters]] [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Men]]

{{Character infobox | name = Sohorat | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = | race = [[Ciphrang]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = | occupation = Potent | relatives = }}
'''Sohorat''' is a [[Ciphrang]], a divine agency (demon) of the [[Outside]], controlled by the [[Scarlet Spires]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 15</ref>
==Appearance== Sohorat’s material form is that of a demon with a cluster of furnace-like eyes, a slavering maw, black wings, and clawed hands.
==Abilities== Sohorat is capable of expelling flies from his mouth and wolves from his palms, though these might just be Analogies of spells in the [[Anagogis|Anagogic]] mould.
==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Sohorat, along with [[Zioz]] and [[Setmahaga]], is commanded by [[Heramari Iyokus]] to attack the [[Cishaurim]] during the battle for [[Shimeh]]. Sohorat’s material body is destroyed by their magic, and Setmahaga’s is struck down by a [[Chorae]]; only Zioz escapes the encounter intact.
==References== <references /> [[Category:Ciphrang]] [[Category:Characters from the Outside]]

{{Character infobox | name = Setmahaga | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = | race = [[Ciphrang]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = | occupation = Potent | relatives = }}
'''Setmahaga''' is a [[Ciphrang]], a divine agency (demon) of the [[Outside]], controlled by the [[Scarlet Spires]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 15</ref>
==Abilities== Setmahaga is strong enough to tear [[Men]] apart with his bare hands.
==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Setmahaga, along with [[Zioz]] and [[Sohorat]], is commanded by [[Heramari Iyokus]] to attack the [[Cishaurim]] during the battle for [[Shimeh]]. Setmahaga is destroyed by a [[Chorae]] and Sohorat is overcome by their [[sorcery]]; only Zioz escapes the encounter intact.
==References== <references /> [[Category:Ciphrang]] [[Category:Characters from the Outside]]

{{Character infobox | name = Skala | titles = Exalt-Captain of the Eöthic Guard | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - ? | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Cepalor]]an | gender = Male | occupation = Exalt-Captain of the [[Eöthic Guard]] | relatives = }}
'''Skala''' is [[Gaenkelti]]’s successor as Exalt-Captain of the Palatial [[Eöthic Guard]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 4</ref>
==Appearance== Skala has blond hair. His face seems ugly or handsome by turns of shadow or light.
==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Skala is appointed head of the Eöthic Guard following the death of his predecessor at the hands of a [[Skin-spies|skin-spy]] impersonating [[Skeaös]]. However, he is unable to prevent the assassination of [[Ikurei Xerius III]] by a skin-spy impersonating [[Ikurei Istriya]].
==References== <references /> [[Category:Characters from Cepalor]] [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Members of the Eöthic Guard]]

{{Character infobox | name = Skaiwarra | titles = Chieftain | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Thunyeri]] | gender = Male | occupation = Chieftain | relatives = }}
'''Skaiwarra''' is a [[Thunyeri]] chieftain.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 7</ref>
==Appearance==
Skaiwarra is stout and blond-haired.
==Story== ===What Came Before=== Skaiwarra was originally a pirate before joining the [[Holy War]] as a Man of the [[Tusk]].
===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Skaiwarra reinforces [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]] at [[Joktha]] with a force of 300 Thunyeri Men-of-the-Tusk. He dies in battle against forces loyal to [[Ikurei Conphas]].
==References== <references/> [[Category:Characters from Thunyerus]] [[Category:Norsirai]]

{{stub}} {{Character infobox | name = Vem-Mithriti | titles = Grandmaster
Vizier-in-Proxy | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Judging Eye (Book) | The Judging Eye]]'' | lived = ? - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Nansur]] | gender = Male | occupation = [[Sorcerer]]
Grandmaster
Vizier-in-Proxy | relatives = }} '''Vem-Mithriti''' is the grandmaster of the [[Imperial Saik]] following the death of [[Cememketri]].{{4|p}} He is very old. ==References== [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Imperial Saik]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Anagogic sorcerers]]

'''''Monius''''' is an epic retelling of the Unification Wars by the famed [[Ainon]]i poet [[Nel-Saripal]].
==Excerpts== Dedication: “On my knees, I offer you that which flies in me. My face to earth, I shout your glory to the heavens. In so surrendering do I conquer. In so yielding do I seize.”{{4|3}}
“[[Momemn]] is the fist in our breast, the beating heart.”
==References== <references /> [[Category:Written works]]

{{Character infobox | name = Sheorog Gauslas | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Ce Tydonn|Tydonni]] | gender = Male | occupation = Soldier | relatives = [[Sheorog Cerjulla]] (father) }}
'''Sheorog Gauslas''' is the son of the [[Ce Tydonn|Tydonni]] Earl [[Sheorog Cerjulla]] and a member of the [[Holy War]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 16</ref>
==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Gauslas is killed by [[Cinganjehoi ab Sakjal]] during the battle for [[Shimeh]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 16</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Characters from Ce Tydonn]] [[Category:Norsirai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Shamanet | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - ? | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Female | occupation = | relatives = [[Esmenet (Tusk)|Esmenet]] (daughter)
[[Oresh]] (grandson) }} '''Shamanet''' is a historical figure referenced in ''[[The Chronicle of the Tusk]]''. She was the mother of [[Esmenet (Tusk)|Esmenet]], the wife of the prophet [[Angeshraël]].''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 15 ==References== [[Category:Characters from Eänna]] [[Category:Men]]

{{Character infobox | name = Oresh | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - ? | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = | relatives = [[Shamanet]] (grandmother)
[[Esmenet (Tusk)|Esmenet]] (mother)
[[Angeshraël]] (father) }} '''Oresh''' is a historical figure mentioned in ''[[The Chronicle of the Tusk]].'' Oresh was the youngest son of the prophet [[Angeshraël]] and his wife [[Esmenet (Tusk)|Esmenet]]. Angeshraël sacrificed him at the foot of [[Mount Kinsureah]] to demonstrate his conviction to the [[Five Tribes of Men]].Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Mount Kinsureah’ ==References== [[Category:Characters from Eänna]] [[Category:Men]]

''Disambiguation: this page is about the historical character named Esmenet. For the contemporary character of the same name, see [[Esmenet]].'' {{Character infobox | name = Esmenet | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - ? | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Female | occupation = Wife of [[Angeshraël]] | relatives = [[Shamanet]] (mother)
[[Oresh]] (son) }} '''Esmenet''' is a historical figure mentioned in ''[[The Chronicle of the Tusk]].'' She was the wife of the prophet [[Angeshraël]] and mother of his son [[Oresh]].Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Angeshraël’ ==References== [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Characters from Eänna]]

{{Character infobox | name = Shalmessa | titles = Shield-Captain | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = [[Javreh]] Shield-Captain | relatives = }}
'''Shalmessa''' is a [[Javreh]] Shield-Captain who serves [[Hanamanu Eleäzaras]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 15</ref>
He dies in the battle for [[Shimeh]].
==References== <references /> [[Category:Members of the Javreh]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Characters from High Ainon]]

{{Character infobox | name = Midru Semper | titles =Baron | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]''
''[[The Unholy Consult]]'' (mentioned) | lived = 4078 - 4121 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity =[[Ketyai]] | nationality =[[Ainon]]i | gender = Male | occupation = Baron | relatives = }} '''Midru Semper''' was a member of the [[Holy War]]. He was a devout believer in the divinity of [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]], and assisted in the expulsion of [[Ikurei Conphas]] from [[Caraskand]]''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 3. In 4121, Semper was murdered by un­known as­sas­sins while sleep­ingEncyclopedic Glossary II, 'Semper, Midru'. ==References== [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Characters from the Three Seas]] [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Characters from High Ainon]]

{{Character infobox | name = Saurnemmi | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = [[Scarlet Spires]] [[sorcerer]] | relatives = }}
'''Saurnemmi''' is a [[sorcerer]] of the [[Scarlet Spires]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 5</ref>
==Appearance==
He is fey and has a chronic cough.
==Story==
===''The Thousandfold Thought''===
Saurnemmi is assigned to [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]] to allow him to keep in contact with [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]] while escorting [[Ikurei Conphas]] to [[Joktha]].
When forces loyal to Conphas take Joktha, Saurnemmi is captured by the [[Imperial Saik]] and placed under a Cant of Compulsion that forces him to continue reporting that everything is normal.
==References== <references/> [[Category:Scarlet Spires]] [[Category:Characters from the Three Seas]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Anagogic sorcerers]]

{{Character infobox | name = Ouras | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = [[Imperial Saik]] [[sorcerer]] | relatives = }}
'''Ouras''' is a [[sorcerer]] of the [[Imperial Saik]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 13</ref>
==Story==
===''The Thousandfold Thought''===
Ouras is a member of the search party sent by [[Ikurei Conphas]] to recapture [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]] after his escape from [[Joktha]]. He is betrayed and murdered by [[Biaxi Sompas]].
==References== <references/> [[Category:Imperial Saik]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Anagogic sorcerers]]

{{Character infobox | name = Orra | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Darkness That Comes Before]]'' | lived = ? - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Female | occupation = Slave | relatives = }}
'''Orra''' is a plump scullery slave of the Gaunum household.
She is taken captive when [[Scylvendi]] under [[Panteruth urs Mutkius]] raid the Gaunum household, but is set free when Panteruth is killed by [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]] and [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]].<ref>''The Darkness That Comes Before'', Chapter 13</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Slaves]] [[Category:Characters from Cepalor]] [[Category:Men]]

{{Character infobox | name = Neberenes | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = Informant | relatives = }}
'''Neberenes''' is an informant for [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 2</ref>
==Story==
===''The Thousandfold Thought''===
Neberenes informs [[Sainhail Werjau]] that [[Aspa Memkumri]] was murdered by the [[Scarlet Spires]].
==References== <references/> [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Characters from the Three Seas]]

{{Character infobox | name = Nau-Ganor | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - ? | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = Author | relatives = }}
'''Nau-Ganor''' was one of the authors of ''[[The Sagas]]''.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 8</ref>
A number of authors contributed to ''The Sagas'', but only Nau-Ganor and [[Heyorthau]] are named.
==References== <references/> [[Category:Writers]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Characters from the Ancient North]]

{{Character infobox | name = Heyorthau | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - ? | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = Author | relatives = }}
'''Heyorthau''' was one of the authors of ''[[The Sagas]]''.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 8</ref>
A number of authors contributed to ''The Sagas'', but only Heyorthau and [[Nau-Ganor]] are named.

{{Character infobox | name = Narstheba | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = [[Scarlet Spires]] [[sorcerer]] | relatives = }}
'''Narstheba''' is a [[sorcerer]] of the [[Scarlet Spires]].
He is slain by the [[Cishaurim]] during the battle for [[Shimeh]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 16</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Scarlet Spires]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Characters from the Three Seas]] [[Category:Anagogic sorcerers]]

{{Character infobox | name = Inrûmmi | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = [[Scarlet Spires]] [[sorcerer]] | relatives = }}
'''Inrûmmi''' is a [[sorcerer]] of the [[Scarlet Spires]].
==Story==
===''The Thousandfold Thought''===
Inrûmmi grants the services of [[Saurnemmi]] to [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]] at [[Joktha]].
He is later slain by the [[Cishaurim]] during the battle for [[Shimeh]].<ref> ''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 16</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Scarlet Spires]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Characters from the Three Seas]] [[Category:Anagogic sorcerers]]

{{Character infobox | name = Marmian | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = [[Mandate]] [[sorcerer]]
Auditor | relatives = }} '''Marmian''' is a [[Mandate]] [[sorcerer]] and an Auditor at their Mission in [[Oswenta]].''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 13 ==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Marmian is at [[Atyersus]] on furlough when [[Maithanet]] arrives and exposes [[Polchias Simas]] as a [[Consult]] [[skin-spy]]. ==References== [[Category:Mandate]] [[Category:Characters from the Three Seas]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Gnostic sorcerers]]

{{Character infobox | name = Maörta | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - | race = [[Skin-spies|Skin-spy]] | ethnicity = | nationality = | gender = Male | occupation = [[Consult]] spy | relatives = }}
'''Maörta''' is a [[Consult]] [[Skin-spies|skin-spy]].
==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Prior to the battle for [[Shimeh]], it receives instruction from [[Aurang]] regarding a plan to prevent [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]] from obtaining the [[Gnosis]] by assassinating his teacher, [[Drusas Achamian]]. However, Maörta does not directly participate in the endeavour. The attack is carried out by a different skin-spy, which fails and dies in the attempt.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 11</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Skin-spies]] [[Category:Characters from Golgotterath]] [[Category:Consult members]]

{{Character infobox | name = Koropos | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Cironj]]i | gender = Male | occupation = Slave
Overseer | relatives = }} '''Koropos''' is a former [[Cironj]]i slave of the [[Kian]]ene who becomes an overseer after [[Gerotha]] is captured by the [[Holy War]].''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 10 ==Appearance== Koropos is a wiry old man. ==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Koropos takes [[Esmenet]]'s body-slave [[Fanashila]] to a [[skin-spy]] impersonating [[Sainhail Werjau]], who kills and replaces her. ==References== [[Category:Slaves]] [[Category:Characters from Cironj]] [[Category:Ketyai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Tirius | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Nansur]] | gender = Male | occupation = Slave
Overseer | relatives = }} '''Tirius''' is a former [[Nansur]] slave of the [[Kianene]] who becoems an overseer after [[Gerotha]] is captured by the [[Holy War]].''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 10 ==References== [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Slaves]] [[Category:Men]]

{{Character infobox | name = Nûkulk Iyengar | titles = Earl | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Warrior-Prophet]]''
''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]''
''[[The Unholy Consult]]'' (mentioned) | lived = 4070 - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Ce Tydonn|Tydonni]] | gender = Male | occupation = Earl of [[Nangael]] | relatives = }} '''Nûkulk''' '''Iyengar''' was the Earl of [[Nangael]] and a member of the [[Holy War]]''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 4Encyclopedic Glossary II, 'Iyengar, Nûkulk'. ==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== As the Holy War marches for [[Gerotha]], Iyengar and the Nangaels under his command take the [[Kian]]ene fortress of [[Kijenicho]] and throw the garrison off the walls. Iyengar is killed by an arrow through the throat during the battle for [[Shimeh]]''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 16. ==References== [[Category:Earls]] [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Characters from Ce Tydonn]] [[Category:Men]]

{{Character infobox | name = Ingaera | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - ? | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Cepalor]]an ([[Nymbricani]]) | gender = Male | occupation = | relatives = [[Serwë]] (daughter)
[[Anasûrimbor Moënghus II]] (grandson) }} '''Ingaera''' is the father of [[Serwë]].''The Darkness That Comes Before'', Chapter 13 Serwë had a happy childhood, but he eventually sold her as a slave to House Guanum. ==References== [[Category:Characters from Cepalor]] [[Category:Norsirai]]

{{Character infobox | name = Imyanax | titles = General of the Cepaloran Auxiliaries | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Cepalor]]an | gender = Male | occupation = General of the Cepaloran Auxiliaries | relatives = }}
'''Imyanax''' is the General of the [[Cepalor]]an Auxiliaries.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 7</ref>
==Story== ===''The Thousandfold Thought''=== Imyanax accompanies [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]] in escorting [[Ikurei Conphas]] to [[Joktha]] after his expulsion from [[Caraskand]]. When Conphas escapes, joins with reinforcements, and attacks the city, Imyanax is among the defenders slain.
==References== <references /> [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Characters from Cepalor]]

{{Character infobox | name = Hûruth V | titles = King | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - ? | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Kûniüri]] | gender = Male | occupation = King of [[Sakarpus]] | relatives = }}
'''Hûruth V''' is an ancient King of [[Sakarpus]] mentioned in ''[[The Sagas]]''.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 8</ref>
[[Seswatha]] was cast out of Sakarpus after cursing Hûruth for not fleeing to [[Mehtsonc]] with the [[Chorae]] Hoard.
==References== <references/> [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Characters from Kûniüri]] [[Category:Kings]]

{{Character infobox | name = Hûkal | titles = Prince of Mongilea | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Ketyai]] | nationality = [[Kian]]ene | gender = Male | occupation = Prince of [[Mongilea]] | relatives = }}
'''Hûkal''' is the Prince of [[Mongilea]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 15</ref>
During the battle for [[Shimeh]] he slays [[Amurrei Ganyatti]].
==References== <references /> [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Characters from Kian]]
#redirect [[Meärji]]

{{Character infobox | name = Horomon | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = mentioned only | lived = ? - ? | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Xerash]]i | gender = Male | occupation = Criminal | relatives = }}
'''Horomon''' is a notorious [[Xerash]]i criminal mentioned in ''[[The Tractate]]''.
Horomon is said to have gone blind as divine punishment from the [[God]] in retribution for putting out the eyes of his enemies. [[Inri Sejenus]] miraculously restored Horomon's sight. This led to the [[Inrithi]] saying “seeing with Horomon’s eyes,” meaning “revelation.”<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 6</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Characters from Kian]] [[Category:Men]]

{{Character infobox | name = Hebarata | titles = Captain | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Kian]]ene | gender = Male | occupation = Captain | relatives = }}
'''Hebarata''' is a grizzled [[Fanim]] veteran who serves at [[Gerotha]].
Hebarata takes a leadership role at Gerotha after [[Utgarangi ab Hoularji]], the Sapatishah-Governor of [[Xerash]], flees. He is killed as part of the so-called "Toll of Days" levied on Gerotha by [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 8</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Characters from Kian]]

{{Character infobox | name = Gotauran ab Suraki | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Kian]]ene | gender = Male | occupation = Architect | relatives = }}
'''Gotauran ab Suraki''' is a great [[Fanim]] architect.
He assists the Fanim forces in undermining the walls of [[Shimeh]] in preparation for their battle for the city against the forces of the [[Holy War]].<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 15</ref>

Unnamed nephew or niece|nicknames = Kel|nationality = [[New Empire]]|occupation = Prince-Imperial}} '''Anasûrimbor Kelmomas''' is the third son and sixth child of [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus|Kellhus]] and [[Esmenet]], and the twin brother of [[Anasûrimbor Samarmas|Samarmas]]. He was named after [[Anasûrimbor Celmomas II]]''The White-Luck Warrior'', Chapter 13. ==Appearance== Kelmomas has curly blond hair, blue eyes''The Judging Eye'', Chapter 3, pale skin''The Great Ordeal'', Chapter 16 and a cherubic face''The Unholy Consult'', Chapter 1. == Personality == He is cunning and murderously jealous of his mother's affection. ==Story== === ''What Came Before'' === From birth, he and his twin locked gazes with the other for the first (very) few years of their lives. If they were ever forced to be apart, each sank into total despondency. Soon after they separated psychologically, it was discovered that Kelmomas inherited [[Dûnyain]] traits while Samarmas did not. ===''The Judging Eye''=== Kelmomas murdered his twin in a very convincing accident. ===''The White Luck Warrior''=== === ''The Great Ordeal'' === Kelmomas is fascinated the [[White-Luck Warrior|Narindar]] and follows him throughout the tunnels of the palace. He feels the [[Ajokli|Four-Horned Brother]] will keep him safe. Kelmomas is afraid that his sister [[Anasûrimbor Theliopa|Theliopa]] will reveal his secrets to their mother.{{6|16}} ===''The Unholy Consult''=== Kelmomas, along with Esmenet, is taken from Momemn to the camp outside [[Golgotterath]] by Kellhus. He stops [[Varalt Sorweel III|Sorweel]], who is acting as an instrument of [[Yatwer]], from killing Kellhus. In the [[Golden Room]], he dispels Ajokli's possession of Kellhus, leading to Kellhus's death. He is forced into the Carapace by the D[[Dûnyain|û]]nyain that have taken over [[Consult|the consult]], and becomes the [[No-God]]. ==Notes== ==References== [[Category:POV characters]] [[Category:Anasûrimbor]] [[Category:Dûnyain]] [[Category:Characters from the New Empire]] [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Prince-Imperials]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Mixed ethnicity]]

Unnamed nephew or niece|nationality = [[New Empire]]|occupation = Prince-Imperial}}'''Anasûrimbor Samarmas''' is the fourth son and seventh and youngest child of [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus|Kellhus]] and [[Esmenet]]. He is the twin brother of [[Anasûrimbor Kelmomas|Kelmomas]]. == Appearance == Samarmas looks identical to his twin Kelmomas''The Judging Eye'', Chapter 3, thus having curly blond hair, blue eyes and pale skin''The Great Ordeal'', Chapter 16. == Personality == He is unique among Kellhus' children in that he did not inherit any of his father's Dûnyain traits. == Story == === ''What Came Before'' === From birth, he and his twin locked gazes with the other for the first (very) few years of their lives. If they were ever forced to be apart, each sank into total despondency. Soon after they separated psychologically, it was discovered that Kelmomas inherited [[Dûnyain]] traits while Samarmas did not. === ''The Judging Eye'' === Samarmas was murdered by his twin Kelmomas in what looked like an accident. === ''The White-Luck Warrior'' === === ''The Great Ordeal'' === === ''The Unholy Consult'' === ==Notes== == References == [[Category:Prince-Imperials]] [[Category:Anasûrimbor]] [[Category:Characters from the New Empire]] [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Mixed ethnicity]] [[Category:Dûnyain]]

{{Character infobox | name = Iëva | titles = | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' (mentioned)
''[[The Judging Eye (Book)|The Judging Eye]]'' (mentioned)
''[[The White-Luck Warrior (Book) | The White-Luck Warrior]]'' (flashbacks only)
''[[The Great Ordeal (Book)|The Great Ordeal]]'' (mentioned)
''[[The Unholy Consult]]'' (mentioned) | lived = 2112 - 2140 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Kûniüri]] | gender = Female | occupation = | relatives = [[Anasûrimbor Celmomas II|Celmomas II]] (father-in-law)
[[Anasûrimbor Nau-Cayûti|Nau-Cayûti]] (husband) }} '''Iëva''' was the wife of [[Anasûrimbor Nau-Cayûti]], the youngest son of [[Anasûrimbor Celmomas II|Celmomas II]], the High King of [[Kûniüri]]. == Story == Iëva was married to Nau-Cayûti in or around 2133[http://www.second-apocalypse.com/index.php?topic=2662.msg44215#msg44215 See here for calculation]. According to [[the Sagas]], she murdered her husband by poisoning himEncyclopedic Glossary, 'Apocalypse'. She is also believed by some scholars to have murdered General [[En-​Kaujalau|En-​Kau­jalau]] in much the same wayAs Iëva was executed in 2140 and En-Kaujalau only died the following year, it would seem that Mandate scholars are right in this matter.. Visions into the past received by [[Drusas Achamian]] through [[Seswatha's Dreams]] later suggested that the poison merely paralyzed Nau-Cayûti''The White-Luck Warrior'', Chapter 12. Iëva was revealed to have been working for [[Consult|the Consult]] "to save her soul" (according to [[Shaeönanra|Shauriatas]])''The Great Ordeal'', Chapter 5 and ensured her husband was buried, rather than burned as was the custom. Nau-Cayûti was then exhumed from his grave by [[Aurang]] and taken as a prisoner to [[Golgotterath]]''The White-Luck Warrior'', Chapter 15. It was eventually discovered that Iëva was responsible for Nau-Cayûti's death, as she was tried and executed for her crime in 2140Encyclopedic Glossary II, 'Iëva'. == Appearance == Iëva had long blonde hair, which was so pale as to be almost white. == Trivia == * Iëva's year of birth is initially given as 2125 and her year of death as 2146''The White-Luck Warrior'', Character and Faction Glossary. However, her entry in the second Encyclopedic Glossary states she was born in 2112 and died in 2140. * Iëva is the only known female member of the Consult. ==Notes== ==References== [[Category:Characters from Kûniüri]] [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Consult members]] [[Category:Men]]

{{Stub}} [[File:Swayali sm.jpg|thumb|300px]] The '''Swayal Compact''' is the first and only [[The Schools|School]] for [[witch]]es in [[Eärwa]]<ref>''The Judging Eye,'' Chapter 2</ref>. It was founded following [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]]’ unification of the [[Three Seas]] into the [[New Empire]]. The school for female [[sorcerer]]s is located in [[Iothiah]]<ref>''The Judging Eye,'' Chapter 3</ref>, and its current Grandmistress is [[Anasûrimbor Serwa]]<ref>''The Judging Eye,'' Chapter 15</ref>.
The Swayal Witches accompany Anasûrimbor Kellhus’s [[Great Ordeal]] on its march to [[Golgotterath]]. When Kellhus declared the Breaking of the Great Ordeal at the Eleventh Council of Potentates, the Swayal Sisterhood was ordered to join the Men of the Middle-North under the command of Prince [[Anasûrimbor Kayûtas]]<ref>''The White-Luck Warrior,'' Chapter 2</ref>.
== Known Members == * [[Anasûrimbor Serwa]] (Grandmistress) * [[Gwanwë]] * [[Herea]] * [[Hûtta-mimot]] * [[Kima]] * [[Mipharal]] * [[Mirûnwe]] * [[Sapharal]] * [[Valsarta]]
==References== <references /> [[Category:Schools]]

{{Character infobox | name = Tsotekara | titles = Grandmaster | nicknames = | appearances = Mentioned only | lived = | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Shiradi Empire|Shiradi]] | gender = Male | occupation = [[Sorcerer]]
Grandmaster of the [[Scarlet Spires]] | relatives = }} '''Tsotekara''' was the Grandmaster of the [[Scarlet Spires]] in ancient times, when they were still known as the Surartu.{{5|15}} He was a contemporary of [[Triamis the Great]]. ==References== [[Category:Grandmasters]] [[Category:Scarlet Spires]] [[Category:Characters from the Shiradi Empire]] [[Category:Anagogic sorcerers]]

The Vokalati are an [[Anagogic]] School of sorcerers from [[Nilnamesh]]. Its name means "sun-wailers" in [[Vaparsi]]. They have constantly attempted to steal the [[Gnosis]] in the past. By the time of the second trilogy, [[Carindûsû]] is their Grandmaster.
== Known Members == * [[Carindûsû]] (Grandmaster at the time of the [[Great Ordeal]]) * [[Ogadûl]] (founder) [[Category:Schools]]

'''Siöl''' was once the largest, most populous and most powerful [[Nonmen|Nonman]] [[Mansion]]. It was located in the [[Great Kayarsus]] Mountains, north of the [[Cerish|Sea of Cerish]], from where its [[Reach]] extended across much of north-eastern [[Eärwa]]. Several thousand years before the [[Breaking of the Gates]], it's king was [[Cû’jara-Cinmoi]], the greatest of the Nonman Kings.
Siöl was already mighty when the [[Incû-Holoinas]] fell from the skies into the south-western peaks of the [[Yimaleti Mountains]], devastating the lands controlled by [[Nin’janjin]], the King of [[Viri]]. Nin'janjin pleaded for aid but Cû’jara-Cinmoi instead invaded and occupied his lands. Faced with famine and starvation, Nin'janjin surrendered without offering battle; Viri became a bloodless tributary of Siöl. Cû’jara-Cinmoi then conquered the mansions of [[Nihrimsul]] - where her King, [[Sin’niroiha]] (“First Among Peoples” in Ihrimsû), was forced to wash the sword of Cû’jara-Cinmoi - and [[Cil-Aujas]]. This extended the Reach of Siöl as far west as the Yimaleti and [[Demua Mountains]] and south to the shores of the [[Meneanor|Meaneanor Sea]], creating one of the largest land empires in the history of Eärwa. Cû’jara-Cinmoi proudly styled himself the "King of Four Mansions"; after the successful rebellion of Nihrimsul he reluctantly adjusted this to "King of Three Mansions".
During the [[Cûno-Inchoroi Wars]], Siöl suffered serious losses in battle, as well as the loss of its entire female population. The Mansion survived the wars - although the records are confusing - but it was then destroyed in the [[Cûno-Halaroi Wars]] that followed the Breaking of the Gates. Indeed, some hold that the Gates and Siöl are one and the same, and the destruction of Siöl heralded the arrival of Men in Eärwa.
Siöl claimed to be the First Mansion, the ancestral home of all Nonmen, founded directly by the progenitors of the Nonmen race in a time so ancient as to defy reckoning. For this reason Siöl took the title "House Primordial", a term used to refer to both the Mansion and its ruling family. Extant records support this, tracing a line of founding from Siöl to first [[Ishoriöl]], [[Viri]], [[Illisserû]], and [[Cil-Aujas]]. Those Mansions turn later founded [[Curunq]], [[Incissal]], and [[Cil-Aumûl]]. Nihrimsul was founded separately and outside of this line of descent, although its claim to have originally founded Siöl (and thus being the true House Primordial) was hotly denied by Siöl.<ref>Encyclopedic Glossary, ‘Cûno-Inchoroi Wars’</ref><ref>Encyclopedic Glossary II, 'Nine Mansions'</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Mansions]]

{{Character infobox | name = Baxatas | titles = General | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book) | The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = | nationality = [[Nansur]] | gender = Male | occupation = General of the [[Selial Column]] | relatives = }}
'''Baxatas''' is the General of the [[Selial Column]] during the [[Holy War]] following the death of [[Praxum Bogras]].
==Story==
===''The Thousandfold Thought''===
Baxatas is among those sent by [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus]] to [[Joktha]] with [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]] and [[Ikurei Conphas]]. He is one of the men loyal to Conphas, and is thus ordered by Cnaiür to be sent away on one of the transports coming for Conphas. When Baxatas arrives at the harbor, his hands are bound and he is being held prisoner by the [[Hemscilvara]], indicating that he resisted the order.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 7</ref> He departs by transport before the beginning of the battle between the Hemscilvara and the forces loyal to Conphas.
==References== <references/> [[Category:Ketyai]] [[Category:Characters from Nansur]] [[Category:Members of the Imperial Army]]

The '''Hemscilvara''' ("the Scylvendi's Men") are an organization of men within the [[Holy War]].
The Hemscilvara are composed of men who rode with [[Cnaiür urs Skiötha]] at [[Shigek]] and followed him thereafter, even after their reassignment by [[Nersei Proyas]]. Cnaiür instructed them in the ways of the [[Scylvendi]]. Their Captain is [[Troyatti]].{{3|7}}
With the exception of Cnaiür himself, the Hemscilvara were annihilated by forces loyal to [[Ikurei Conphas]] at [[Joktha]].
==References== <references /> [[Category:Organizations]]

'''''The New Analytics''''' is a work of philosophy by [[Parcis]].
==Extracts==
"Doubt begets understanding, and understanding begets compassion. Verily, it is conviction that kills."<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought'', Chapter 16</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Written works]]

{{Character infobox | name = Damergal | titles = Earl of Cuärweth | nicknames = | appearances = ''[[The Thousandfold Thought (Book)|The Thousandfold Thought]]'' | lived = ? - 4112 | race = [[Men]] | ethnicity = [[Norsirai]] | nationality = [[Ce Tydonn|Tydonni]] | gender = Male | occupation = Earl of [[Cuärweth]] | relatives = }}
'''Damergal''' is the Earl of [[Cuärweth]] and a member of the [[Holy War]].
He is slain during the battle for [[Shimeh]] when struck by a block thrown from an archway above him.<ref>''The Thousandfold Thought,'' Chapter 16</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Earls]] [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Characters from Ce Tydonn]]

The '''Mihtrûl''' was a [[Gnosis|Gnostic]] [[School]] of the Ancient North, destroyed during the [[Apocalypse]].
Some remaining [[sorcery|sorcerous]] artifacts created by the School, discovered in the Coffers of the [[Library of Sauglish]] by [[Drusas Achamian]] and [[Mimara]], include a shirt of [[sheära]] and an enchanted knife that Mimara names [[Chipmunk]].
The school was founded by nonman [[Siqu]] [[Emilidis]].
== Known Members == * [[Davdûl]] (Grandmaster) * [[Emilidis]] (founder)
==References== <references /> [[Category:Schools]]

'''Sheära''' ("Sun-skin") is a type of enchanted mail created by the ancient [[School]] of [[Mihtrûl]].
In [[The White-Luck Warrior (Book)|The White-Luck Warrior]], [[Drusas Achamian]] discovers a shirt of sheära in the Coffers of the [[Library of Sauglish]], which he gives to [[Mimara]]. The mail is golden in color, as light as silk but as hard as [[nimil]], and hums with warmth.<ref>''The White-Luck Warrior'', Chapter 15</ref>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Sorcerous artifacts]]

'''Chipmunk''' is a magic knife found by [[Mimara]] in the Coffers of the [[Library of Sauglish]].
It is made of bronze and engraved with glowering runes<ref>''The White-Luck Warrior'', Chapter 15, p. 578</ref>. It was enchanted by the ancient [[School]] of [[Mihtrûl]] to have an otherworldly edge, capable of cutting with ease despite feeling rounded to the touch. It also cuts only according to the wielder's desire<ref>''The White-Luck Warrior'', Interlude, p. 584</ref>.
In ''The Great Ordeal'', Mimara and [[Drusas Achamian]] catch the Dunyain boy scraping it against a [[chorae]]. Achamian says that it must have been made by [[Emilidis]], the greatest of the the ancient [[Nonmen]] artificers, which is why it was stored in the Coffers<ref>''The Great Ordeal'', Chapter 17, p.470</ref>.
==References== <references/> [[Category:Sorcerous artifacts]]

{{Stub}}{{Character_infobox |name = Varalt Sorweel III |titles = King |nicknames = Sorwa
Horse-King |nationality = [[Sakarpus|Sakarpi]] |gender = Male |occupation = King of [[Sakarpus]] |relatives = [[Varalt Harweel II]] (father)
[[Varalt Sorweel III's mother|Unnamed mother]]|appearances = ''[[The Judging Eye (Book) | The Judging Eye]]''
''[[The White-Luck Warrior (Book) | The White-Luck Warrior]]''
''[[The Great Ordeal (Book) | The Great Ordeal]]''
''[[The Unholy Consult]]'' |race = [[Men]]|lived = ca. 4115[http://www.second-apocalypse.com/index.php?topic=2498.msg45214#msg45214 See here for estimation] - 4132|ethnicity = [[Norsirai]]}} '''Varalt Sorweel''' '''III''' is the King of [[Sakarpus]] and the only son of Varalt Harweel II, the former King of Sakarpus. ==Story== ===''The Judging Eye''=== In [[Sakarpus]], Sorweel finds himself staring down upon the boggling might of the Great Ordeal. Standing with his father on the high curtain walls, he realizes that he and his people are doomed. [[Varalt Harweel II|King Harweel]] commands that Sorweel be taken to safety. Dragged away screaming, the young man watches sorcerous flames engulf the parapets and his father upon them. A desperate flight ensues, and it seems that the [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus|Aspect-Emperor]] himself pursues them through the chaotic streets. The pursuit ends in the apparent safety of the citadel. Blasting through walls, Anasûrimbor Kellhus kills his protectors, embraces the Prince, and tells him that he is forgiven. The city secured, Sorweel becomes the new king of Sacarpus. Before the host departs, [[Anasûrimbor Moënghus II|Moënghus]] and [[Anasûrimbor Kayûtas|Kayûtas]], the eldest sons of Anasûrimbor Kellhus, visit him in his palace. They tell him he is to join the Ordeal as the symbol of his nation's commitment to their holy cause. The following day Sorweel finds himself part of the Scions, a horse company composed of princely hostages from across the rim of the [[New Empire]]. This is how he meets and befriends [[Zsoronga ut Nganka’kull]], the Successor Prince of [[Zeüm]]. A [[Mandate]] sorcerer named [[Eskeles]] is assigned to tutor him in Sheyic, the common tongue of the Three Seas, and through him the young King learns the reasons why so many worship the Aspect-Emperor so fervently. For the first time he begins to doubt his father... What if the Aspect-Emperor spoke true? Sorweel is also provided a slave named [[Porsparian]] to attend to his needs. One night Sorweel watches him tear away the turf and mould the face of the Goddess [[Yatwer]] from the dirt. Before his eyes, mud bubbles up as spit from her earthen lips. The slave palms this mud and smears it across the incredulous King's cheeks. The following morning Sorweel attends a Council of Potentates with Zsoronga and Eskeles. He watches the Aspect-Emperor move from lord to lord, declaring the truths they think hidden in their souls. He fears what will happen when he sees the hatred and treachery smouldering in his own. But when Anasûrimbor Kellhus comes to him, he congratulates Sorweel for grasping the truth and, before everyone assembled, declares him one of the Believer-Kings. ===''The White-Luck Warrior''=== ===''The Unholy Consult''=== ==Notes== ==References== [[Category:POV characters]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Kings]] [[Category:Characters from Sakarpus]] [[Category:Great Ordeal]]

{{Character_infobox |name = Varalt Harweel II |titles = King |appearances = ''[[The Judging Eye (Book)|The Judging Eye]]''
''[[The White-Luck Warrior]]'' (mentioned)
''[[The Great Ordeal]]'' (mentioned)
''[[The Unholy Consult]]'' (mentioned) |race = [[Men]] |nationality = [[Sakarpus|Sakarpi]] |gender = Male |occupation = King of [[Sakarpus]] |relatives = [[Varalt Sorweel III's mother|Unnamed wife]]
[[Varalt Sorweel III]] (son)|lived = ? - 4132|ethnicity = [[Norsirai]]}} '''Varalt Harweel II''' is a former King of [[Sakarpus]]. He was the father of [[Varalt Sorweel]], the current King of Sakarpus and hostage of the [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus|Aspect-Emperor]]. ==Story== ===The Judging Eye=== Harweel rejects the Aspect-Emperor's demand to yield Sakarpus and its famed [[Chorae]] Hoard. Later, he is killed during the [[Great Ordeal|Great Ordeal's]] assault on the city.''The Judging Eye'', Chapter 1 ==References== [[Category:Characters from Sakarpus]] [[Category:Kings]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Norsirai]]

Unnamed nephew
Unnamed nephew or niece|nationality = [[New Empire]]}} '''Anasûrimbor''' '''Serwa''' is the second daughter and third child of [[Anasûrimbor Kellhus |Kellhus]] and [[Esmenet]], and Grandmistress of the only school for sorceresses in [[Eärwa]], the [[Swayal Compact|Swayal Sisterhood]]. She was named after [[Serwë]]''The Judging Eye'', Chapter 15. ==Appearance== Serwa is considered very beautiful''The Judging Eye'', Chapter 10. She is tall and slender, with long flaxen hair''The White-Luck Warrior'', Chapter 10 and blue eyes. Her skin is pale, and she has freckles about the bridge of her nose''The Unholy Consult'', Chapter 11. Her profile resembles that of her mother on the silver Kellic. After she is hit by a pulse of the [[Sun Lance]] during the battle for [[Golgotterath]]''The Unholy Consult'', Chapter 15, Serwa is severely burned. Her hair is almost completely burned off, and ulcerating burns cover the majority of her body, with only part of her face, the lower part of her legs and pubic area remaining unburnt''The Unholy Consult'', Chapter 16. Close to the end of her duel with [[Skuthula]], Serwa is struck by a [[Chorae]], which salts off part of her right arm. == Skills == Serwa is widely thought to be the most powerful witch in the world''The White-Luck Warrior'', What Has Come Before''The Unholy Consult'', Chapter 12. She is one of only three sorcerers capable of performing Metagnostic cants such as the Cant of Translocation''The White-Luck Warrior'', Chapter 13. ==Story== === ''What Came Before'' === Serwa was born in [[Carythusal]] during the [[Unification Wars]]Encyclopedic Glossary II, "Unification Wars'. At the age of three, it was discovered that she possessed the Gift of the [[the Few|Few]] and she was sent to [[Iothiah]] to be raised among the Swayal witches''The Judging Eye'', Chapter 3. Esmenet, who was strongly opposed to this decision, never quite forgave Kellhus for it. ===''The Judging Eye''=== Serwa is mentioned as marching with her father and her brothers [[Anasûrimbor Moënghus II|Moënghus]] and [[Anasûrimbor Kayûtas|Kayûtas]] in the Great Ordeal. She is present in the meeting [[Varalt Sorweel|Sorweel]] has with Kayûtas (in which he is informed a [[Thanteus Eskeles|tutor]] has been chosen for him). Serwa also attends the Council of Potentates, in which Sorweel is declared a Believer-King. ===''The White-Luck Warrior''=== Serwa, Moënghus, and Sorweel are sent to the Nonman mansion of [[Ishterebinth]] to act as hostages. It is revealed she suffers the same nightmares experienced by [[Mandate]] Schoolmen of the [[Apocalypse]] as witnessed through [[Seswatha]]'s eyes. === ''The Great Ordeal'' === ===''The Unholy Consult''=== Serwa duels the great [[Wracu]] known as Skuthula the Black within the [[Intrinsic Gate]] during the final cataclysmic battle for Golgotterath''The Unholy Consult, ''Chapter 18. ==Notes== ==References== [[Category:Anasûrimbor]] [[Category:Grandmasters]] [[Category:Dûnyain]] [[Category:Swayali]] [[Category:Norsirai]] [[Category:Characters from the New Empire]] [[Category:Gnostic sorcerers]] [[Category:POV characters]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Great Ordeal]] [[Category:Mixed ethnicity]]
